r_Xuhp18ua3HLJw-_YJq4A.text: We love Cornish Pasty, but are not thrilled with this location. I've been here a couple of times now (we usually go to the one in Mesa or Tempe) and both times the service was very slow, didn't really care that we were there ordering a decent amount of food and the food did not come out as hot as it does as other locations. That leads me to believe the server just didn't bring us our food right when it was ready. I had to get up and go find him to ask for a dessert and check.   We probably won't go back to this location because of the current wait staff but will definitely go to the other spots!

4_IJKetQTVR6j5QgSgjDvA.text: Best stopover for food when you're lit (weekends or weeknights), done after work downtown, and also takeout.  Had about 7 different pastys by now, main is the bacon and cajun cause their sauce on the side brings it all full circle.   I can always get one thing from here or multiple things so definitely a regular here.  The other pastys are a little heavy but they have a lot of selections to choose from.  You won't ever regret the pb&j pasty with ice cream!

wicKiM6hVMWNlU4m2sWLNA.text: First time coming here and I was blown away by the sheer number of choices! Everything sounded good and it was hard to nail it down to just one. I really wish I would've came with hubby so we could have each selected different ones and split them. I finally decided on the Cottage Pie. Seasoned ground beef with mashed potatoes, peas, and carrots all wrapped up in a buttery crust. The filling was spot on with the ratios. It came with a red wine gravy that was excellent. It was very filling and I can't believe that I was able to eat the entire thing. They had several different side options that you could purchase and many of them sounded good however I chose not to get any because the prices seemed a little high for one person. I really liked how the restaurant has three different levels that you can choose to dine in as well as an outside patio. They had a wide assortment of beers and cocktails but because it was my lunch hour from work I stuck with an iced tea.  Too bad because honestly the iced tea tasted kind of off.

All tasted amazing and were large filling portions. The pasta salad had quite a bit of dressing, so if you are not a fan of a lot of dressing you may want to get it on the side. zGC2FTWKKOVjedR1JtLbAw.text: I am a die hard pasty fan and was dumbstruck with joy to find this place in the middle of downtown Phoenix!  The restaurant has a fabulous dark wood (but open air in front) ambience and enthusiastic in-character wait staff who seemed to love pasty as much as I do.  It was *so* hard to chose which one to order.  As I was in the Southwest, I opted for the southwestern style Carne Adovada with pork and chili peppers.  Yes, it sounds weird for a Pasty.  My reasoning was that if this was going to be good anywhere, it would be here in Phoenix.  And it was awesome!  Succulent pork, mildly spicy chilli peppers, with a small amount of rice and beans (hard to notice actually).  Really unusual to have a pastry crust over something like a burrito, but it worked.  In speaking with the server, I learned that this restaurant has other locations throughout the country, including one in Boston.  I may have to look into mail ordering from this place...

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street view
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu 1
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu 2

FqNagQf6mDgc0rizAF_urw.text: If you know anything about the history of the cornish pasty, it's that miners used to eat it as meals; there's extra dough on the outside so that the could just eat it with their index finger and thumb - so that their food wouldn't get dirty (even though they themselves might have been dirty from the mines).  I know this because these mines originated in the U.P. (Upper Peninsula in Michigan); and I actually came with two Yoopers - my husband and his good friend. They grew up their entire lives eating pasties. Tough crowd! What's the verdict? These pasties lived up to their expectations! We each got a different one. Mine happened to be Thanksgiving themed; filled with turkey, a wine gravy, stuffing, and cranberry sauce. I couldn't have asked for a tastier pasty. We also ordered a Shepard's Pie themed one, and that  had everything a hearty meal could ask for, lamb, potatoes, veggies. It was delicious!  The only reason I'm knocking a star is that the service was only OK. I waited ten minutes to get a drink, and our appetizer was brought out with our meals, which was definitely unusual. I understand we went during happy hour on a Friday, and they were short staffed, but still.  Overall, I would definitely come back again to get more pasties!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mviM6_gdrC8Uqeylan0lqg.text: One of my favorite places.   They always have a huge variety (including a wonderful vegetarian and vegan selection). It's affordable and always delicious. It's a great place to meet up for happy hour or take out-of-town visitors. All locations have a different ambiance but the menu is consistent throughout.

6djUv9pCMrsTwnzQajvB-Q.text: What a treat to be in Phoenix for work and to have a throw back Cornish pasty and Scottish egg!!! They had the British original as well as some new flavors but they were awesome! Amazing flavors and great recommendations!

qYbbqsOVtpuKVINIS73l1g.text: Soooo excited there's a Pasty near me!  I visited today and had my favorite Sherpards Pie.  It's best to pre-order as it takes time to cook these babies!  Call ahead, unless you're on a date ;) The service was great, the food was just as I expected and enjoyed the nice breeze where I sat just in front. It's a very classy place to eat, so stop complaining about some disrespectful prink writing on their bathroom walls, and enjoy the amazing food and view.    Parking was not bad, just had to park in the public lot for $2.00 around the corner.  Sure, it's not parking in front, but you're talking about a prime beautiful location, so pay the $2 for public parking and enjoy yourself.  I'm excited to visit again soon and try other tasty selections.

ISroKYoMB41QzLT_0G701w.text: Ive always been a fan of Cornish Pasty and have enjoyed trying different items on their menu. This location, like the others, offer a dark atmosphere. However with its downtown location, there are multiple levels, and the upstairs is quite spacious with ample seating and views to the street below. Great service and my drink was filled every time. My go to favorites are the Pilgrim and Chicken Pesto. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Great service too!

WyeV9Do3vM0zLGaySqxsuQ.text: What a great find! Wonderful food at great prices. My friends and I ordered a variety and shared them (which is the best way to go). The carne adovado pasty was delicious with the right amount of heat. The Greek chicken...so tasty! And the peppered steak with Stilton cheese was hearty. Unfortunately, we were too full to get dessert. I guess we'll have to come back again!

OxlrZUYn9-p5I_ajQaxpEA.text: Awesome. Great atmosphere, delicious food and drinks, excellent service. And they were baby friendly, which means a lot when it's a pain in the ass to get out of the house in the first place. Thanks for an awesome time Cornish Pasty, we'll be back many times for sure.

R57zCW3qsKJSJo8Hsm4Lqw.text: Visited this location for the first time because I've heard the food is delicious. However, my family and I were not tended to for a good 15 minutes. I finally decided to pipe up and said to a worker "excuse me" and she turned to us with a sigh and eyeroll and said "ya..." My fiance said we have been waiting for 15 minutes can we get a menu? Then she proceeded to tell us she was not our server but could get someone to help us. (Mind you she was walking in and out of the restraunt looking like she was bored out of her mind, so who knows what her purpose was there because we were told it was self seating...) After i got the hint she did not want to truly help us or do her job, we decided to go else where. We are generous customers but I will not give our money to servers who don't want to do their job and help their  customers, especially who are newly visiting or especially give our money to people who mock us for leaving. Shame on you Cornish for employeeing poorly motivated and educated workers.

VFGBt289rth2R8D6bnR0Ig.text: Unique atmosphere with a variety of music. I tried the spanikopita and the rosemary steak pasties and there were very good and paired with good dipping options.  Im giving 4 stars because service severely lacked. We we're passed by several times and only offered refills when we we're clearly irritated. It could just be an off day because it's a slow Sunday morning and they maybe just aren't on the ball as usual. I'll try it again when it's busier and hopefully service will be better. There are pool tables and dart boards and soon will have a pool tournament so there seems to be a fun vibe and effort to be than a standard downtown restaurant which I can appreciate.

8uRMp7i4_FgKhvb3yIFFbw.text: I really enjoy the food at Cornish. It's always delicious! I have yet to have anything bad. The food is fantastic no complaints there.   However, I would NOT return to this location on the basis the service was subpar. We arrived for a friend's birthday party, said our hellos and made our way to the bar to order our drinks. It was 20 minutes before any of the bar staff acknowledged we had arrived to order. We had two people receive drinks before us.  After we finally made our food and drink order we promptly received our drinks that were delicious and mixed well. If you've ever been to a Cornish you know the food takes a bit of time because they make it fresh when you order it which is why I love it here. Unfortunately, with making our drinks the bartender forgot to put in my order into the till. So we saw orders come out of the kitchen but were told no one submitted the order at all. After mentioning that we were not going to take the food after all. The bartender sounded very annoyed at the thought that I declined the food.   I understand it's a busy time of the night and everyone feeling flustered at how busy it is. I've been there, but customer service should never suffer because of it.

JabQA5A1YIIIiQwdRapc7Q.text: Love this place. Such great comfort food. The pasty is a family favourite of mine and finding this place (there are several around the Phoenix area) was a godsend. There is plenty of good choices to be made from the menu, with old regulars like the Oggie to more boutique pasties.. salads are great and healthy - we often have a salad and share a pasty between us.. and sometimes not!  However, this place does a great job at living up too the famous Cornish pasties of old.. New flavours with traditional style = great food! Plenty of beverage options and staff who go the extra distance to make sure everything is perfect.

gZ4uZXuJR7MnrdcE-N32eg.text: Well. This has been my worst experience at a Cornish to date. We got here as part of a group event in the upstairs bar and were among the first to arrive. We took our seats at the end of the bar and waited 20 minutes for someone to take our beer order. Another 30 minutes go by, empty glasses, and we are unable to get a drink or a menu. People walk right by us. We finally flag someone down (a really rude blonde woman) and place our order. Another 30 minutes go by and we have no food and more empty beers. Unable to Flag her down again, our food arrives only it is wrong and we still have empty drinks. It takes 10 minutes for us to tell a server our drinks are wrong and another 19 to get mor drinks.  As I write this, we are still awaiting our food and we have been here almost two hours.   Usually I love this place and I come here a lot but this is unacceptable and makes me want to find another place. :/  Aaron, the manager was great. He was very nice and apologetic while we were there and followed up with us via email. I'm hoping to get back in the next week or two to update my review.

z3cyOUsT00FoLM8QdPGSWA.text: The service...oh man it was painful to watch our server not even pretend to not be annoyed by our presence. It was about 7pm on a Sunday evening. The bottom floor was dead. We had a group of five and captain sunshine was our server. He looked miserable, walked away every chance he got and made us feel bad for being there. Even after an attempt to strike up small talk to ease him up a bit he still looked pissed off. He kept saying "I think we are out of that" but never checked to confirm or suggest something else in its place. The food was pretty good. The chicken pate was odd and something I wouldn't order again. The rest of it was pretty good. The interior is really cool. I think had we not sat downstairs and had better service we would of enjoyed it more.

_vXCvZsbEdhiauvQhw0biw.text: I have been going to this place since 2013. They have a very nice set both inside and outside . They have same dishes since 2013. But the quality of their food is excellent.  I again visited them in Sep 2017 since I was travelling back to  Phoenix. Again same awesome experience in service and food quality. I really miss my days in Phoenix when I used to be regular at their place . I have been to both Tempe and Scottsdale location and both are equally good.

ui7bWUQhc5ywUVFOpZiaYQ.text: I love the design of the Phoenix location. The ground level and upstairs have an upbeat vibe with more activity and louder music. The lounge downstairs is perfect if you want a relaxed atmosphere where you can easily carry on a conversation. The food and drinks are excellent and they're open late. A fantastic addition to the growing night life downtown.

iZaJ5zV9ZxbFWirGncEMow.text: Yes. Yes. Yes. It's finally open. My husband and I have loved Cornish pasty for so long and were so happy there is finally one close to home. If you are asking yourself, "what is a pasty?" Just think of the most fancy and delicious hot pocket with fine and gourmet ingredients that your brain can handle, and multiply its deliciousness by 1000. And then you're close to a dish from here. Just go. You will love it. And have a banoffee after!!

jaC7cuQMmggdRzhzjJ2Pvg.text: It was pretty good, a lot of food for the price. The place was pretty cool to look at. I ordered the chicken pot pie it was tasty. I would go again, they had a bunch of different things on the menu if your adventurous with your food.

tZUoH8-dPLadu7zLwvhDQQ.text: Got the Pilgrim, Turkey fresh off the bird, sweet potatoes, stuffing, grilled onions. Side of red wine gravy and a cup of cranberry sauce. Even John Wayne himself would be proud of this pasty, pilgrim! Place has cool vibe and I will be back

MJpb_N5bb2osUDd-IP21wQ.text: Found this place by searching Yelp and was close to the area of a great ice cream shop I frequent. Had the meatball pasty and was so good came back the next day to try the chicken pesto. Highly recommend and cute little spot with multiple levels for seating.

zmyKD8OIKs_HvWFElvyaiA.text: Really bad lunch service for a downtown restaurant ..... my colleagues and I went for lunch and it was first come first serve seating . We were seated upstairs and no waiter or waitress came for about 15 minutes , so I decided to go find menus and a waiter . -a6NblWioyWxdqMWTe8yqg.text: Great place great atmosphere. I like the pilgim and the chicken greek the best. I have been eating at the Mesa tocation for the last decade, but moved downtown and love the vibe at the downtown location.

oF13hzhRX7Et8MLQwfHtmA.text: Went over the July 4th holiday and could not have been more disappointed.  Ordered the Royale with Cheese and my girlfriend got a veggie order. From the time we sat down until we got our order was almost an hour! It was a good thing we were staying across the street at San Carlos, or I would've been really annoyed if I had to have drive any distance to get home. The waitress (skinny brunette with glasses) decided it was more important to pay attention to a group of women that came in that bought a bunch of booze than us. When we finally received our food, it was good, but not worth the wait. If you feel like being ignored because you don't wanna by booze with your dinner, this place is for you! Will not be coming back.

qUS_s9NKeSaPg3C7512Rog.text: Love this place. Have eaten at all their locations and they do no wrong. This I feel is their best one yet. Very homely and it has pool table and darts upstairs. It's their first few days so they have to iron out a few things to find their stride. But this will be a great addition to the downtown food scene.

GXGYyvC5BMkYWhaB5tJzUw.text: The eagerly anticipated Cornish Pasty downtown did not disappoint!  All your pasty goodness in the heart of downtown.  They had a blood orange citrus cider on tap that was delicious and of course the pasties were all we expected them to be.  They were very busy but someone stepped in to serve us and apologized for the wait.  So happy to have our own Cornish Pasty closer to home!

52K5wFpBufYy2wuYcFqHNg.text: I called about 20 different restaurants in Downtown PHX to find a space where I could host my husband's 40th bday dinner and about 30 guests. Most downtown restaurants require a $150-200 fee just to reserve a private or semi-private dining area, and any party larger than 20 people would require a prix fixe menu and/or a a buffet style at a per person cost billed to the hostess. I didn't want to charge my guests, and I couldn't afford to pay for all of them myself. I also didn't want to limit what they could order with a prix fixe menu. When I called Cornish Pasty on Monroe, they happily worked with me and didn't seem phased by this at all. (I even visited the party and called again in advance to make sure there wasn't a catch!) They even allowed my guests to order and pay for  their own food on separate tabs, which I can understand is probably a nightmare scenario for a restaurant. The tables they reserved for us were in a semi-private area up in the second floor loft where all the pool tables and dartboards were. So, it was a lot of fun for our guests. The server was superb - as responsive, quick and accommodating as you could expect for that many people. He even worked to secure us an extra table during dinner rush hour when it became clear that 5 people to a bench was not a realistic estimate. Everyone said their pasties were on-point and a perfect start to my husband's 40th birthday pub crawl downtown. Well done, Cornish Pasty! Thank you!

OzJAG8bDTmoPamEY7j2dlQ.text: Let me start off by saying I WAS a huge fan of Cornish Pasty. I am a frequent visitor of the Tempe location, and this experience was a HUGE letdown. I called in to place my order for pickup " Can I get XXXX. No we are out of that. Ok what about XXXX. No we don't have those either... what about XXXX. Ummm let me check, not we don't have those..." finally after finding a Pasty that they actually have available I am told it will be ready in 15 minutes. I head down to the restaurant and give the server my name. I am told it will be another minute or two. 25 minutes later I ask how much longer it will be. Oh sorry there was a technical difficulties so it will literally only be another minute... 30 minutes later my food comes out. No remedy for the situation and no sorry about your hour lunch that was wasted. To top it off as I'm signing my receipt one of the cooks come up to me and says "Oh your XXXX" that's really good timing your food just came out... um no jackass I have been waiting in your restaurant for over an hour now its god awful timing...  Ok so after all of that grief I get back home and open my pasty to find it charred black on the bottom... I give up. Cornish Pasty will not get my business anymore.    ***Update, the Owner has reached out to me after this incident and is working with me to make amends. I decided to visit again a few days later and i received great timely service, they have a full menu now and food was ready when i got there and was fresh and delicious.Thank you for your effort. ***

52GOC-g1eB60M9ct1CKOgQ.text: The venue has multiple levels. We dined upstairs, where there were tables, bar, darts and pool tables. The food was good. Having never had a Cornish pasty, I was surprised that it was firmer and crispier like a calzone.

dNX3yLMcIwbbGKwtm0o1nw.text: I've been to all of the Cornish Pasty locations in Arizona and the downtown Phoenix location is by far my favorite. No matter where you sit be it in the dark, speakeasy-esque downstairs or the spacious top level of the building, the service and atmosphere is great.   I always like to highlight Cornish Pasty's vegan and vegetarian pasty menu. It can be tough to find a veggie friendly spot, let alone one that has their own section of the menu, but Cornish always has my back. My absolute favorite is the veggie cottage pie pasty. The flavors are excellent and the texture of the "ground beef" really makes the dish. It's a great vegetarian alternative for a classic dish.    Another one of my favorite dishes that I absolutely rave about is the potato and leek soup. TO DIE FOR. It's creamy, rich, and is delicious with bread.   I will continue to be a customer for life and *always* look forward to a meal at Cornish Pasty.

swPGsc0Acdf_9i-oeshUgg.text: Good food good service.  Free pool and darts downtown and pet friendly.  I love to get these to go while walking my dog. One meal will usually give me two servings.

ncnxF_qivq_QQmOlciHMvg.text: I enjoyed my experience at Cornish Pasty. Very unique building with 3 different levels and 3 different atmospheres. I sat on the top floor honestly because that's where most of the people we're sitting.   Staff was great, very attentive and friendly.   Food was unique. Basically a delicious meal wrapped up into a pastry.  I ordered the scotch egg (which was good) and the Tikka masala pasty which was great.   One thing that concerned me was that you can't make edits/special requests to the food. That screams frozen premade food to me. BUT my meal came out using delicious and not previously frozen.   Prices are very good. All pastys are around $11 and they have an ok happy hour.   If I had my way with this place, I wish I could get 2 or 3 pastys for the same price. Lots of different options to choose from so I really would have liked to try multiple of them vs the one big one.   I would definitely come back here to try the different pastys as the number of options is great.   Give them a shot!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

npMQ59R0FXRZJ4PyLkRQjw.text: I think I had a bad pasty but my daughters was delicious! When I told the wait staff I didn't like my food I insisted on paying for it anyways, she gave me a discount and I really loved that. Great service and other than the dish I ordered, great food. Cool ambience too!

1EmQ6gkQfh2Nu9rKqiDi3w.text: Wonderful atmosphere with 3 levels for dining options and each one has its own unique atmosphere.  Main floor your sexy bartender is also your server and great personality and interaction to make you feel at home and having fun.   Great selection of local craft brews to make the night enjoyable.  Pasty selection is top notch with variety and everyone is scrumptious.

C5iUTmbx2THSNWiQreKpLg.text: My only experience with Cornish Pasty Co. stems from dining at their Mesa location last summer. Despite a few service quips, I was pretty impressed. This particular location, situated on Monroe Street, is a bit different in setup, but still excellent in regards to food quality.  First off, be aware that you'll need to seat yourself. Mesa's Cornish location has a hostess. This might result in some confusion. There are three levels, but I've only eaten in the basement by choice. The area is filled with multiple leather/mobster booths and a seedy "dive" feel. Ideally, it's where I would hang out if I wanted to hide from the rest of the world and just eat pasties and play board games all night.  It's really hard to recommend pasties here, because everything we've ordered is excellent quality. It really boils down to personal preference. I've never been a big meat/potatoes guy, so I'm more drawn to their Italian-styled pasties, while my girlfriend always defaults to their Pilgrim due to her love of traditional Thanksgiving food. There are no disappointments to be found here, which is the result of ingredients that are solid quality and a shortcrust that packs flavor and fluffy texture.  For dessert, despite the constant Yelp recommendations for the banoffee pie, we struggle at passing up their chocolate bread and butter pudding. The booze inclusion is subtle and satisfying. It's warm interior with a crispy outer-shell just makes it irresistible, but eventually we'll cave and try something else.  Cool environment, great food, and reasonable prices for what you receive. How can you not Cornish give it a strong recommendation?

Sadly the Deli is sold to Tavern Deli so I met my fiance at Cornish Pastry around the corner. I'm so glad we did new experience and I loved it. I had the Roast Dinner with pot roast, roasted Brussels sprouts and carrots and rutabaga etc...  in a flakey delish pastry. Served with side creamy horseradish. My fiance got the Cajun Chicken both very good! And I like the environment and I say up stairs overlooking the kitchen where you can watch them prepare the delicious filled pastries. A must try!  Happy Eats!

ksX_IbOCPW8e-5GVn0JEow.text: First time at the downtown location and we loved it.. it feels like it's been there forever .. that old world charm.  We chose to sit upstairs in the black leather love seat chairs by the bar.. the bartender brought us menus and when the guys couldn't decide on which beer to have he brought them samples.. awesome service!!   From our seats we could see the pastys being made.. they sure make it look easy..   I ordered the chicken pot pie.. it was delish.. that pastry crust is perfect with the veggie, chicken & gravy filing. We shared the garlic roasted potatoes, also very good!   We'll be back to enjoy a drink and some pool.. and make our way through the menu. Lots of vegetarian & vegan options.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasty production
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Italian pasty
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted potatoes

5_8l_ULt6E7af4kpPyTOPA.text: Horrible service I came Wednesday night and sitting on second floor, the bartender gave us attitude  and I was so mad and I got out of place. They  definitely need to train bartender customers service.

dnIQqs4Tjyl6eMVwh2WTGw.text: I just ordered a Lamb and Mint pastie and Oven Chips.  The pastie was extremely salty and I had to throw it out, which is not a thing I do.  The crust was really good, so I'm guessing I caught them on a bad day and they just messed up the filling by quadrupling the amount of salt in the filling.  The oven chips were some of the worst fries I've ever had, probably second worst.  They were leathery and very dry, like potato jerky.  I chucked those too.  Very disappointing for such an expensive meal.

tUzZWvfjfE5vPAvJ872yVQ.text: Still somewhat amazed to know that a place selling Cornish pasties exists in Arizona of all places. That alone deserves a bunch of thumbs up. I had the Guiness and steak (I think one) - rather good. Interesting that they're closed and crimped at the top rather than on the side. Must come back for more. Oh - lovely atmos, nice staff.

KrUUalGgtRm_VkPsLrPYFA.text: I've eaten at the downtown location and had a great experience every time! Recently did a takeout order and was super impressed with their promptness and packaging of the pasties and their sauces. By the time I got home, everything was still hot and delicious.

PzRtnKsAzLBoNt0p7rQAPA.text: The wait for food is painfully long.... and its just as excruciatingly long waiting for the check after you request it. The food is subpar, not bad, not great. The service however, solidifies that i will never be returning to any Cornish Pasty in the valley.

A-6m4-BZYhuMxRbVNLb4hw.text: Absolutely love this place! The history alone of how the "Pasty" came to be and is somewhat maybe even still celebrated in areas - is awesome.   I know Cornish Pasty is definitely celebrated here in Phoenix. The chefs are "locals" who used to work for Pita Jungle and used their crafty minds and excellent expertise to create an environment and an idea that grew to be something so big and beautiful. A restaurant with delicious food and a place for everyone to enjoy.   Proud of you guys - from a former PJ employee.

1Y2mJq-1Mv7Yx0ULjyHaIA.text: The ambiance of this location is so very on point. I love the upstairs seating, it really does feel like you're in a different world. The lighting is much improved from the Scottsdale location - I can actually see my fellow diners and the food that I'm eating. The pool tables and dart boards are definitely a plus.  Moving into the food...I had the vegan soup of the day, it was veggie noodle. Nothing special but the bread is always good. We also ordered the vegan vindaloo pasty with curried potatoes and "chicken" it was a big spicy for me, but I was able to enjoy a few bites. We ended the night with a really tasty apple pie pasty served with vanilla ice cream. It was really freaking good, went like the snap of a finger.   The service was chill, but attentive. You bet I'll be back at this location!

BjHO7yS0XuHKz6qKU2AMVQ.text: Great late night stop in downtown PHX ago pick up a yummy pasty!  There are all types and each is delicious- a must stop!

XlNcENxUtQWuoocosJT9jQ.text: Wow!  Wow!   Stopped in for desert after an evening in Phoenix.  Ordered the Carmel apply pasty and the Pavlova.  Best desert I have ever had (and we have had several!). Will be back to try main dishes

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

f5mQxLVbEG_pD0sneQsQhg.text: The atmosphere is absolutely amazing for a low key, hang out or date night. I had a traditional pasty because I wanted a baseline for what it was since I had never had one before and I had to stop myself half way through because it was HUGE but I wanted to eat it the next day so I could do it twice haha. The art on the walls and soft ambiance was perfect for our date night.

IPf2OcTsgApCneOReJfmYw.text: Yum. There are so many options to choose from. I looked over the other side of the menu from the pasties, after I ordered. It looks so amazing and if it hadn't been just me I would have tried more. I devoured my Guinness pasty. I was looking for something a little OG, but this looked better than but close enough to their oggies. I was expecting it to be more greasy and heavy, but man, this was awesome. The outside was crisp all the way til the last bite. The bar staff was awesome. They delt with me while I weighed my options. I had a peanut butter stout to top it off. Ahhh, side note, sitting at the bar, you can also watch some chefs working on the pasties. I left perfectly satisfied and if I ever find myself back here... I may be right back at cornish pasty.

Vgpsnfft_BXTOhVXjgyIpA.text: Caught me by surprise. One of the most unique menus I have ever experienced. Been 4 times at 3 locations and they were consistently well-staffed, practically invisibly well-managed, and DELICIOUS. A great friend introduced me and I'm your huckleberry if you try it yourself.

bDEcrVJYPcq3D37tD9WuWA.text: Haley took such great care of us!! Scotch Egg was amazing and ALL the other food we ate was great too. If in Phoenix this is a must stop!!

Fe-09GEffyAVCCvuCtsbJQ.text: Utterly disgusted with the poor service at this place. I honestly would give ZERO stars, if possible. I've been patiently waiting for the opening of this spot downtown and boy was it a big let down.   The decor is amazing. It's sort of a mix of a bar and a church! Three levels of great space. The downer...you'll never get your food.   Got in after the lunch rush, so the restaurant wasn't packed. Ordered our food and was told it would take no more than 15-20 minutes.....drum roll. We waited 55 minutes and got no food! Not a joke at all...I actually would've preferred it be a joke.   I noticed a table behind us get their food and I stopped a server (not my server because he never came back) to see how that could be when they came in about 15-20 min after we did. He went to check and advised our ticket "got lost" and that our food would be out in two minutes. Fast forward 12 minutes later, still no food. My original server locked eyes with me and I believe he might've tinkled on himself because he could tell I wasn't a happy camper.   We got up and told him we're leaving. His response...an excuse. He said our order got behind a big ass table upstairs. Those were literally his words. I let him know I don't care what the excuse was, it's unacceptable. All he did was apologize, no attempts to remedy the issue.   I was seriously excited about the opening of this place, but the chances of me visiting again to give them another shot...slim to Hell No! First impressions are lasting, especially when the service is terrible. Customers don't like to hear excuses, they want solutions. Hell, they actually just want their food. That's what they come for in the first place...good eats!  You have a ton of work to do, Cornish Pasty. Good luck.

tIxIh6wlOtL6DPrW9aRP3w.text: I've been to the Cornish Pasty Co. in Tempe many times and have paid visits to the Chandler and Scottsdale locations as well but this is my first visit to the DTPhx location since it (seemingly took FOREVER to be) opened. I really love what they did with this building with the garage doors and patio seating. It was perfect for the overcast cool day and we came in here to check it out for lunch.  Unfortunately, my time here was marred by the extremely slow service. When coming in for lunch in a place downtown, on a Monday afternoon, the servers should be aware that everyone has to get back to their own jobs within a certain time frame. Pasties that are made ahead with a couple of ice waters should not make for an hour-long visit. We also made the mistake of getting a dessert which just tacked on more time and we had to flag down the server to get it to go after sitting waiting for 15 minutes. I've never had a problem with wait times before so I can't  say if the staff just wasn't on their best game or what, but it was really disappointing. I absolutely love CP Co. but I'll make sure to skip this location unless I have plenty of time to spare.

4s3xQTjTNs5tCGNEUEX9YQ.text: We stopped in last night after hearing Cornish Pasty finally opened the night before...so exciting for our downtown neighborhood!  There are three levels to the restaurant, so we checked each one out before deciding to sit upstairs in the "pub-like" atmosphere.  I ordered a chicken tikka masala pasty and a blood orange cider...so delicious!    Overall, great atmosphere, great service and great food - a welcome addition to our neighborhood!

Js3yy9MboH5TxZJaZIsQUw.text: A good place to try,  especially if you haven't had a pasty.  Stopped here before a Dbacks game. Ate downstairs at a very nice bar/lounge area, nice dark lighting and intimate feel. Definitely check it out   Menu is pretty extensive, chose the Royale w/Cheese. You can choose any two dipping sauces off the menu which is nice too.  Overall, I thought the food was just ok. Maybe I picked the wrong thing. However, Lea my waitress/bartender was amazing. Seek her out, friendly and knowledgeable, fun chatting with.  I'll be back, wanted to try the lamb vindaloo. Lea recommended the salmon.

I1HGv-c0psNnN-1tW_Jliw.text: I was eagerly anticipating this opening as I work right around the block and love Cornish Pasty Co. It seemed like they took forever to open but they finally did and I was psyched!  I avoided going there for the first few weeks as I heard it was a bit crazy and unorganized. I have been there twice for lunch and once for early dinner/happy hour.  The food is pretty much the same, delicious as always. My favorite is still the veggie chicken tikka pasty. The service is very chill and friendly, just like the other locations.  The atmosphere is very special. It is an old, historic building and has three very cool levels and a nice patio for people watching. The basement is my favorite. It reminds me of a speakeasy.  My only complaint is they do not have a happy hour. We went there thinking there would be and we were disappointed to be informed they don't have one "yet". They need to work on their happy hour game! Us downtown workers love to get our drink on and we love our happy hour so hop to it Cornish Pasty Company!

-8_91n6iRrNp3GRwQli-Lw.text: FUCKING FINALLY!  Been to plenty of CPs around the valley and this one is distinguishable only by its decidedly downtown vibe. But what really sets this place apart is the truly inspired tap list: Gulden Draak? 1664? Bacchus? Fullers ESB??? YES PLEASE.  Factor in Lou Reed blaring on the stereo upon walking in and this afternoon just went from 6 to midnight

8sCUZDUIArNAbpbK26ij4w.text: Positive: The place is absolutely stunning! Was so excited to bring friends here for a drink.  Negative: Was shocked that a round of of 4 pints of LOCAL brew came out to $30! $7.50 pints?... Seriously obscene! This is probably why it was dead on a Saturday night. Unfortunately, this is not the kind of place you can treat friends. Seamus (across the street) is standing room only because their pints are NOT $7.50 lol  The George & Dragon has us spoiled with their $5 British Brew! Cornish Pasty is pretty tho... sigh. : \

pgaUWTOqqXOLQcPWeOaX3Q.text: Second time I've came back to this place, the first time that I came I had already eaten - saw the menu and decided I had to come back and try something!  My date and I ordered the pilgrim and the herbed beef - they were both delicious. My only complaint was that the center of mine was a little cool, other than that the food was great.   They also have a nice list of craft cocktails, I would recommend this place.

qoNyryAVKa6iXR0MT39Dgg.text: Stopped by around 6pm on a Monday with a friend, the place was pretty empty so we were able to find a spot very easily...the first person who saw me looking around approached me with a huge smile and told me they had 3 levels and to sit wherever, very nice first impression.  Ordered the broccoli & cauliflower cheese bake to start which was pretty good, had quite a bit of cheese and veggies...then I ordered the Cajun chicken and my friend got the Italian. The crust was perfect and all of the ingredients worked well together. Overall the service was great and we had a good time, only reason I gave them 4 stars was because our appetizer and the pasties came out at the same time which is always annoying to me.

jaTOhGveRIVG_85eihofDw.text: The food here is good, but parking downtown is a nightmare, so I twice ordered take-out that was picked up and delivered by a food delivery service. The restaurant got the order wrong both times. They've lost a good customer.

vahLZK1OqPrRv-MtjmpdLw.text: During a recent stay in the area we were walking around looking for a place to try for a beer and some food. The name caught my eye and we decided to give it a try (especially after noticing Guinness on tap). It seems like it would be a small place judging from the outside but there is seating up stairs, down stairs, on the main level, and outside. We found a place right by the doors which turned out to be perfect.  The menu is amazing with so many great options. They even have a couple vegan options and various vegetarian dishes as well. Husband tried the Italian and I tried the Lamb and Mint. They were so good and full of flavor.  I wanted to try the PB&J dessert, but was too full. Next time for sure!

lBDisbN2gj28_MV_PGF3Pw.text: Awful service and the food is okay, but prepared by people running their hands through their hair, scratching their beards then handling the food.    Everyone working here had the too cool for school attitude.  Nobody approached us to let us know you seat yourself.  This place tries to be more of a scene than a great food spot.  It fails to execute in both areas.    I heard the Tempe spot was great, so when they opened a downtown Phoenix location I thought I'd give it a try.   I recommend you pass.

zvmtncjmnsa-ct-he0t3Ug.text: Food is good, but the menu really isn't designed at all for the downtown lunch crowd. A half (or mini) pasty and soup or salad feature would really help. So would seating designed more for small lunch groups. As is both the food and restaurant are basically designed to cater to drunk college kids on a night out.   Still good, but limits the spot as a lunchtime meetup

zYm9X7sDSdUPpO-RLbrYZw.text: I stumbled across this restaurant and decided to give it a try. First of all our server Leah was nothing short of outstanding. Excellent service. As for the the food, my wife is very hard to please as she is an executive chef and has been for over 30 years. No complaints from either of us. I have to say I eat pastas every time I'm in Escanaba Michigan during smelt season. My Oggie Original Pasty was as good if not better than what I get up there in Escanaba. My wife had a salad that was 100% fresh lettuce and vegetables. They have an excellent choice of beers on tap and a very friendly atmosphere. I will most definitely be taking my Michigan guests there for dinner when they come to Phoenix for a visit. Once again great job Leah thanks for a memorable lunch.

67Ho3gmZZOwstb-hTTIH5Q.text: have already been to the new location 3 times. same great food, same great beer, same great service, but, man, what a lay-out! three floors with a bar on each. pool tables, church pews, dim lighting, brick walls, 80s metal playing, beer flowing. wow-woah-weeeee. (i did that in a Christopher Walken voice)  typically, i am a str8 Oggie or Bangers and Mash type of guy with the occasional sprinkle of Shepard's pie. HOWEVER, new developments have occurred in my life. and just between you and me... wow-woah-weeee. I am talking about the Roast Dinner. order it. Roast Beef, potatoes, rutabaga. And then, just when you are lulled into a savory sense of security BAM that Ms. Candi Karat and Sir Sprout von Brussels come in and do a number on ya! bing bang BOOM! POW POW! YAWK YAWK YAWK YAWK.  excuse me. just go and i will stop embarrassing myself

Mkooh1ZAlKhMvRytwDIYmA.text: Stayed in Phoenix last weekend to go to Kenny Chesney's concert at Chase Field and were starving after the concert.  This place got bombarded at 11 pm with folks hungry like us.  Hubby had the Chicken Pot Pie pastry which he devoured and I had the Cuban pasty.  Both were delicious.  Highly recommend trying this place out.  And, I wish there was a place like this that I could go to near us in Huntington Beach.

F9nzeZEMpcQQMJfaBQCqsA.text: The basement bar is a cool environment, but the quality of the food at this location is not up to the same standard as the Mesa location. Our food came over cooked, with the chips being burnt. Too bad. Try another location instead.

uD1PEuHiHSDpnsHe0E4SJA.text: We really enjoyed the atmosphere here! Definitely a lively feel and the open kitchen gives you a chance to watch the chefs hard at work hand-making each pastry. Good draft list too!

nFFrsnTIEXoOXCiAYhtVjA.text: I was thoroughly disappointed with the service the waitress provided last night.  I'm out celebrating my friends birthday and the waitress had the nerve to have an attitude when I told her I didn't want the fries I had ordered because they never came.  She proceeds to tell me she didn't even put the order in because I was questioning the fries on how they were cooked.  She then proceeded to waive her hands in the air at me. Saying she ASSUMED I didn't want them?!.  Im so glad I kept my cool on that chick and she walked away.  I will NEVER step foot in that place again.  Not to mention the food sucked I ordered the wings and they tasted half raw.  This place was the joke of the night.  Stay away!!

WWv6YCxgvj9JKTWSvgyzzA.text: Happened across Cornish Pasty after a show at the Crescent Ballroom. The shepherd's pie was the perfect home style meal after a long day of work and a late night at the show. The downstairs captures a mellow speakeasy feel. The upstairs has darts, pool tables, and a pew style seating area. The UK style menu has savory pasties (pastry case with beef and veggies) and even some Indian style dishes like chicken vindaloo. Cornish Pasty offers a great atmosphere and is perfect for a date or evening with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Downstairs speakeasy
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Upstairs seating area

qQj6NWvZIz9GWC3dXngqKg.text: The service was fantastic. Drinks were great and the food was up to par. Flaky crust and great filling. My friend and I had a great night. Highly recommend.

FwVYxpv7h6o0ArUenei99g.text: I'm giving only 3 stars for management's information and not to discourage people from dining here.  Went here with a large group of colleagues. Called ahead to let them know of our imminent arrival. Despite the advance notice they didn't have a large enough table ready. Then it took a full half hour to take our orders. Then another 30-45 minutes to get our food. The server distributed bills and collected money before the food was served.   The food was excellent.  The experience with a large group at lunch needs significant improvement.

Id40Y7udqpkKcVYx__6jAA.text: Really yummy pasties with an edgy decor. This place is cool and does great food. Not healthy, but there is plenty of kale salad in Phx for your next meal!

_L1bVmU6w_J46DUNYLBzZg.text: Had the rueben simply awesome. Crust was just right. Nice open view kitchen.  3 levels of seating.  Wish could transport it to where i live

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Had the rueben simply awesome. Crust was just right. Nice open view kitchen.  Wish could transport it to where i live.

DdmXdWOL_bSS17iIr0Qusg.text: Coming to this place is always a treat. The food is amazing and they have vegan options that are delicious which I love. I almost always get the vegan vindaloo and it never disappoints! The service is always friendly, fast and over all great. I love the atmosphere and they have a walk up window if you're not feeling like going inside. This place is awesome.

6nrUfd5XK1e-FYbT9dsMAw.text: Finally open! Thank you sweet baby Jesus! Loved the Tempe location & Old Town Scottsdale but it was a hella drive from the West Side. So I love that this location is open in Downtown PHX. Great food & staff. Brittany is hands down the best server they've got. Always smiling, quick & knowledgeable about the menu. I really enjoy that they change it up with the menu & have special Pasty's. I had the corn beef on St Patty's before the night began & it hit the spot. Of course the reg menu isn't a schlep at all. I just like it when the chef has some fun. Can't wait to get back to this location. Enjoy!

RA3c7aa9l59HEXQk_ptzbw.text: Hutch was very welcoming and friendly one reason we will return. Thank you Hutch. The food is amazing and next time we will do dinner.

Nvbgr_6VAbUP2Vi1aNmr5w.text: Found out some of my coworkers had never been to a cornish pasty so I got online and couldn't believe this one was here! I have been to the Mesa and Scottsdale location and this one was just as good! We picked a spot upstairs in a cozy booth and relaxed while we waited for our pasty. They told us it would be about 15 minutes because they make them fresh and we enjoyed our drinks. Everyone loved theirs. I had the adobo and it was the right blend of cheese and sauce and pork. Came with sour cream and salsa. We got banafee pie for dessert and it has become one of my favorite desserts. Service was good, place was packed, they maybe could have used one more server but someone else came grab our checks so it looked like the manager was helping out to get everyone out in a reasonable amount of time. Not a great place if you are in a rush for lunch but it is worth the wait! Great meal, good service, cool relaxed atmosphere.

9bRWO7m-wnvVyYvomOsQJw.text: Nothing special. Came with a group of friends for a nice dinner and the food was just okay, first of all, the item I wanted, they ran out of. So I picked another and again, they were out of it. A friend of mine as well as I, had to order something we were settling on. The cocktail menu selection was very limited, so again, it was choose from this menu of three things or get a glass of wine. I guess I just expected a wider menu for signature cocktails given it's such a niche restaurant.  On top of that, we had a table that was pretty much no lighting except for the two tea light candles. I couldn't even see what I was eating, so that was a bit of a turn off from coming back.   The food was okay, the music was too loud to have a normal conversation, and there was almost no light to even see what was in my food. Probably won't be back here unless someone convinces me otherwise.

OnptHWOpePjjGwQDVgaaMQ.text: Really cute environment and ambiance. Great selection of cocktails and beers on tap. This was actually my first experience trying a pasty. I tried a cheeseburger-style pasty and I thought it was pretty good. It was interesting how they also stuffed French fries in it... yum! Another thing to note is that the menu is really plentiful and you definitely won't fall short of options.

LFAZ3od5Uphg_-r3Uv987Q.text: Went with family including a kid after Sunday performance at the Herberger. Everyone was happy with their pasties even the kid who said she didn't like mushroom but eat the whole thing. Excellent beer choices and I had a really great cider. The place is large with room for darts and pool tables. Great family place with great food. Waitstaff was helpful and friendly.

8bMlTptelO4U7HTuMUrzxQ.text: Good beer selection (including local brews), good service, tasty pasty's - good standby downtown (i think this is a chain however). Not fine dining, but I'll be back.

YQdzjyLO8WkmElP30S5tKA.text: It was ok! Pasties was ok nothing to go out of your way for. But the 2 missing stars was for the mushroom soup, it was super salty that I couldn't eat it :( and I'm someone that add salt to mg food for no reason so go figure how salty that was, big fail

TaWEObVXUA9BXAJv2cnZRA.text: Love this spot! And the food is amazing! I always try to order something new when I come here and have not had one bad pasty! The upstairs area has become one of my favorite places to hangout with friends and grab a drink and play some pool! Definitely worth checking out this downtown location!

AxaEI4NSqLP0RaMIIVTs7g.text: Great service, cold beer and an interesting product.  Had lunch and the food was great. The servings are large and you can share an appetizer plus a pasty with a friend.

2BjW3HAAt-IXTGMrVlmMsg.text: So... are you closed? This is what we asked as we sat upstairs waiting for 15 minutes before anyone actually gave us any notice. We went downstairs to grab a cocktail and brought it upstairs to sit down. No hostess... No one even bothered to look over for 15 minutes. It wasn't until we actually stop someone walking by for the fifth time to ask if they were closed that the waitress said oh... "Well you had drinks so we figured you were served at the bar." Yes we were served at the bar but not offered any menus so we came upstairs for food. we were told... Yeah you have to ask for menus. Is this the new age of dining? I really hope not.  If you go to Cornish pasty eat before you arrive, only come for drinks and go downstairs. More than likely, that's the only place you will get served.

0-weoT5iobr21hepUqTkXQ.text: This place had such promise from the outside. Looks hip and has a nice space. We sat down and ordered from their decent veer list, which came quickly, but then for some reason it took about 50 minutes to get our meal. It didn't seem all that busy and food was visibly backed up on the kitchen line  The waitress was nice enough to give us a discount because of the delay, but waiting almost an hour for mediocre food was just not acceptable.  And then to boot, my friend got sick with diarrhea and vomit all night. We didn't eat or drink anywhere else, so I think it was from this place. Overall, I would not recommend this place.

V8VK2dtSHz88fLKMYX7aIA.text: Super cool little spot!  The menu is really diverse and big for being pretty much completely made up of pasties. There are vegan options that are absolutely amazing!!! I literally thought they gave us the wrong one because the fake chicken was so convincing! Drinks were really good, rosemarys baby cocktail was the all around favorite but the lavender honey being a close second. Great service from the server who's name I forgot with the long dark hair who makes boom boxes out of old suitcases. Will be returning!

jk9H28LX6j7hgMKwTKkBHg.text: Delilah, the bartender, saved my view of this place. Always great drinks and prompt service! I never know what I want, just give her an idea, and she always whips up the best cocktails! Thanks Delilah!

1aPAqs4Z4DgM24634JLFIQ.text: Cornish Pasty is truly a treat every time I go! They have an amazing selection of pasty's and also an extensive drink menu! It can get very busy on the weekends but they have three levels of seating which makes it nice! I recommend going on a weeknight or the option to get a half baked pasty to go is one of my favorites!

yQEzkOz3BI3I4CP5zoGBNg.text: Came here with a group of my cousins and some fitness. We were a large group and our server was able to handle all orders and got them all correct. I arrived early and ordered the pie smasher drink, it is very tasty if you like bourbon and what makes it interesting that it has a balsamic vinegar reduction in it.    For my meal I ordered the Reuben Pasty and it was delicious every bite til the end. Definitely recommend this place and will definitely return.

6ll5sKp3VWwokVX1xUFuhg.text: I don't normally write reviews... I came in today and had such a great experience that I felt like I had to. I believe my servers name was hailey and she was so kind and gave me great recommendations. I felt like she was genuine and gave me a run down of the history and building and pasties. This place is HUGE. Definitely will come back at night to see the lounge and play pool. Definitely recommend!

MJ7WSJ04s9w-eWZ1eLdkPA.text: Yelp 100 Challenge 2018: 34/100  Came here on a Wednesday night to find this place not too crowded. There are people at the bar area and at the upstairs game area as well.   My boyfriend and I say down and ordered. There weren't too many tables but we still waited over 30 minutes to get our food. It was 9 pm when we sat down so needless to say we were pretty hangry by the time the food finally came.   Service was ok, food was ok. What's so special about this place? Its like blaze except they need to bake the pastry a bit more.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KxcVRcfeEB39oY6RB7mRUA.text: See how there is no food in front of us? That's because this is the worst service I have received to date. I have been to the Scottsdale and Tempe locations but the one downtown is AWFUL. It's seat yourself (chaotic but okay) but I was there for 40 whole minutes and no one wanted to take my order. I had two waitresses look me in the eye and ignore me when I tried to reach out. On a Saturday night, you're better off going to another location. I'm disgusted.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AUTJ5pi1rWIkr_Y8ki8CsA.text: Each Cornish Pasty is unique and has a different vibe. The food is always consistent and on point with each location and beer selections vary some. I recommend checking out each level of the downtown location (they have 3 different levels). Each level has a different vibe and enjoyable in their own right - don't forget the basement in the summer especially. The upper level has pool tables and by far has the most seating. Watch the homeless population for this location, it can be a bit distracting when trying to enjoy the outdoor seating area.

-7Tl-aibPLebBZqmvwjj_A.text: Always one of my favorites no matter which location I go to. That being said I think the Phoenix location has the most atmosphere. Solid selection of vegetarian options.

e1NSZ7CLLbNVJpRVGjqpog.text: I was visiting from Texas and my girlfriend brought me here. It lived up to the hype. I had the Carne Avovada and it was amazing. Tasted like I would expect from a Mexican stew. I tried a couple bites of the Bangers and Mash too; it was just as good. Now, I want to come back and work my way through the menu. Service was good. Food was hot. This is a place I'd come regularly.

Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Avovada

5TWMS0tq_nGuO77gsY_8DQ.text: I'm going to start with a confession: I've been to CPC three times in the last week. So I might be a bit biased...in a good way. Cornish Pasty Company brings the charm of a British pasty shop and placed it in a low key setting (several, actually) in the Valley. What they have created is a family-friendly dive that's great for food and drinks.  As for the location, the Phoenix spot is amazing. You might think of it as one restaurant but it's actually a restaurant and three bars, each with its own character. The basement is a lounge, the ground floor is a pretenseless pub, and the top (where I always end up), is a chill bar. The place keeps their food simple, while offering a vast array. Seriously, there's gotta be about 40 pasties, a third of which are vegetarian (and maybe even vegan). I've tried about six of them over the last few visits (go with friends so you can share) and, while I have favorites of the lot, I haven't had one that disappoints. Speaking of other things that don't disappoint--the beer list. While not as expansive as the pasty list, there's something for everyone. Oh, and the bartenders can mix up great cocktails. Seriously, I love this place--whether it's a stop on a night out or the main event, it doesn't disappoint.

NVCdItneiJMOdynmzM5ImQ.text: I came here on New Year's Eve day. Always a good vibe inside. Went upstairs play some pool in order some beers. Very cozy and dim environment.  First time I'm trying to food over here. I got the spicy Asiago chicken Pasty and I also tried the carne adovada Pasty.  I really like the carne adovada Pasty as opposed to the spicy Asiago chicken. The port in the carne adovada was really juicy and flavorful. You get a side of sour cream and salsa, which I just lather onto the Pasty. Would definitely recommend trying the carne. The spicy Asiago chicken was okay, I'm but I'm not too big into the Hatch Chiles, and there was less flavor with the chicken compared to the pork. Wasn't really spicy in my opinion.  Spicy Asiago chicken was around $10.50 + tax*  The carne adovada was $12 plus tax.  Really like the free pool tables that they have upstairs, easy way to pass the time. Also good window seating upstairs.  The Waitresses were super friendly and attentive.   Come check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

d4J-ZtocXXVuofpCu_U0cA.text: I'm a Brit and I took my co workers to this location last week. I love the East Valley Location's and the food at those restaurants is amazing.   This review is only for the Phoenix location as I have previously not had any problems with the Cornish Pasty.   The service was not good, the young girl that served us made it feel like a chore for her to be doing so. My food was great, lamb and mint pasty is my go to!   Everyone else's food was not even okay. One persons food was forgotten, they brought it out later but it was cold in the middle. She begrudgingly took it back, and bought it back to him, practically threw it on the table, still cold! They didn't charge him, but he was turned off by the service and look of his meal, that he left it behind anyway.  I asked for extra gravy as the portions for gravy are way too small. She said, "well I have to go down stairs to get it"! Like she was trying to get me to say don't worry about it. . She did come back with it quickly despite "having to go downstairs" and once again kinda dumped it on the table, along with salt and pepper that another person requested.  No one got a drink refill automatically. We had to wave her back to us to order our food and to get a drink refill, which was again dropped on the table I thought it would spill over.   Really unimpressed with this girl. Not the one with a bunch of tattoos, but a younger girl.   The Oggie my friend ordered was "dry and tasteless" and my other co worker reported his food was warm but not hot. So generally a disappointing experience, especially considering that the other locations in Mesa and Tempe have been completely different experiences for me.   I have been to this phoenix location a few times now and each time received a sub par experience especially with service and quality of the food. I'll avoid this location from now on I think. The East Valley Location's are worth the travel though.

DPfj8dQbiOI5YgJVreAV9Q.text: First time in Phoenix, our flight was delayed, my GF and I arrived at our hotel super hungry around 11:30PM. Hopeless that there wouldn't be any places open this place came in clutch! We got there ordered appetizers, 2 drinks each and a full entree for around $80. Which is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PD0zOkVPhmVlRrHa0gkXLg.text: Cornish Pasty Co is too unique to pass up. I lived in England for two years and they get it done right here. Their kitchen serves a mix of traditional choices along with versions you might or might not find in a modern British Pub. The Ploughman's Platter and Chicken Pate are nice pieces from Anglia's rural past while the Pasties are from the mining and manufacturing regions of England. They also have salads, bacon meatballs, Scotch Eggs, traditional soups (Leek, Tomato, Mushroom etc.), beans,peas and mashed. Do not miss!

dtf4C1aWY1mGg8pJ6esYuA.text: The kitchen was slow on cooking up the pasty that I ordered up.  Besides the lag during the lunch run, the peppered steak pasty with mushrooms and leek, was a bit on the salty side, but very homely to eat.  It was surely a filler and complimenting with a beer, which they have a variety to choose from.   There were other pasties to try as well. Thanksgiving is coming up so I was on the edge to try turkey with stuffing pasty, but was thinking that I will have a feast of that in the coming month!  One staff knew his pasties so he recommended well.  They have 3 tea selections and it was refreshing for the warm day.    It's a spacious pub and sort of looks antique.  It suits the pub pasty experience.  Lots of room for dining!   Comfort spot!

TIR3GFk9W1JgOdu2hwUCFA.text: Vegan review: The downtown location of Cornish Pasty has much to offer vegans and vegetarians! The location itself is awesome. You can pick between three levels (basement, main floor and loft) and the patio - which is a rare treat in Phoenix. It's the perfect dark, cool spot to beat the summer heat.  They have a vast array of vegetarian pasty options and always have up to four vegan options on hand. I've had the vegan southwestern pasty before and enjoyed it, but had a hard time believing it was vegan! They used a mock chicken - probably Gardein - and vegan cheese. However, the vindaloo is my favorite of the vegan options. The first time I had it, it was almost too spicy for me (which is rare) but my second try had the perfect amount of heat. It was a little heavy on the potatoes, and they could have been cooked more, but it was filling and delicious. The best part is always the crust!   Service is fast and efficient - no issues. And the location is close to everything. So if you need a cool place to eat and drink in downtown Phoenix, don't overlook Cornish Pasty!

H7QEZx0Gq6tDyip-wlr2aQ.text: This place has a definite British pub feel. Not surprisingly, the menu is mostly pasties, which I love. Unfortunately, I'm experimenting with a low-carb diet right now. :(  I ordered the scotch egg to start. It came warm and quartered on a shallow bed of lettuce with a mustard sauce. (Despite years in the U.K., I never learned to appreciate "brown sauce.") The reheating (you have to do that) made the edges a little crispy but I didn't mind.  Since the sausage on the scotch egg was tasty, I decided to get the sausage salad (low-carbing, remember?). Unfortunately, they were out of sausage. So, I decided to get the tandoori wings to go.  Tandoori wings: Yum! Full of flavor. Tender. Meat easily separating from the bone.  So, why only 4 stars? The restaurant is too dark. They didn't have what I ordered. My tomatoes (accompaniment for the wings) were slightly white and puffy. (I didn't try them.)

0-ijvLQMrR9aCGewP2rOqQ.text: Finally got a chance to try Cornish Pastry and it was definitely worth the hype. My husband and I went for lunch and sat upstairs. We got a nice view of the main floor and the kitchen. It was pretty cool getting to watch all the pastries get made. They measure ever ingredient. We split both The Oggie (The Traditional Pasty) $9.75 Steak, potato, onion, and rutabaga (swede) with a side of red wine gravy and Cubano $12.00 House pulled Mojo pork, ham, swiss cheese, dill pickles, and yellow mustard. Served with mustard cream sauce, spicy mustard, or extra yellow mustard. We wanted to try the Oggie because it seemed like the traditional thing. It was good but OH MY... That Cubano was one of the best versions of a Cuban I have ever had and this girl loves her Cubans. That mustard cream sauce paired perfectly with the ham and pickles. The crust was out of this world. I will go back just for another Cubano and this time keep the whole thing to myself. One of my favorite things about this place is the cool vibe too. I believe it is all original furniture, carpeting, some fixtures, booths, and bar's from the original building. I found that very charming! Next time I come I want to check out the basement, I heard it has speakeasy vibes.

Ofl7wdDGLfMhZpY-rvaqqw.text: Did you know this 3rd location opened?!  I didn't until I walked by their sidewalk cart. Wow, what a great idea. Take your pasty on the go just like they were originally intended.  Yes, I ate mine in the car while driving back to work.  Also, did you know that they have a vegan version that is AMAZING? Thank you Cornish, I really appreciated this today!  The only complaint was the $15 it cost from essentially a sidewalk card for a pasty and tea. Just a little high in my opinion.

RI6NbIFnC_bbx9ZaFTVeDQ.text: Really!!! I can't believe how expensive of side of pastry chip that got today. They make me shocked. 4 small pieces for $4. Look at the picture, you will know how small it is. Honestly, I just ordered them yesterday same this order and before in many times except I order just one side order of pastry chip. I know what exactly size is. They always give a big box and full for one side order. (You can see how it differ from yesterday and today from the picture) This time, I order one more side order. It means two of it. I suppose to get two big boxes. When I got it, I saw just one box. Then, I ask Lucy (who took my order) I got only one side. She said they put together. I told her last time I order one side why get the same side with last time. She just brings it back, and separated in two small box, and take some out, too. Really!! You do that!! I've been there many many time, never get bad experience like this before. But this bad experience from Lucy will make me won't go back there anymore.

RZjUqLfq_ly6BJpFUs3gOg.text: Great food, very atmospheric. Loved it! Definitely recommend to anyone who loves meat pies.

Uh9sz6pxNxlzpVum1e69AQ.text: Always good. Great environment. Great beer options. And the food is awesome as it always has been since I would go to the one in tempe

lYTaCTmhq10nxToHFQXMeQ.text: What an awesome find in downtown Phoenix. Chicken tikka masala pasty was awesome! Flaky crust, well seasoned filling, and just delicious.  Sat at the bar, watching the chefs/bakers hand make each of their various pasties.  Everyone in the place seemed happy, and the variety looked amazing.

UXx4zmw5atWLWh9iVETsCw.text: Love this place. They've got great drinks and amazing food. They have a pasty (basically a giant hot pocket) for everyone and every craving from Mediterranean to pot pie. They're very filling and decently priced, you can't go wrong.

uHrOLBz-c49_4QmJx8rxnw.text: I'd leave 0 stars if I could. Service was terrible. Food was less than mediocre. Hot pockets at home are better. Again, service was horrible. Won't come back ever again.

pmHn2ZxNFMdkenwmHa8ZBw.text: Used to love the pasty before I had to change my diet. Met some friends here recently (their choice) and I wish there were more gluten free options for those of us who can't eat their pasty dough - even a soup (using corn starch instead of flour) would do. The one thing on the menu I could order - the chicken tikka salad - is dry, flavorless and disappointing.  Cool building though! Patio is the hot commodity.

TZmU_yBE5ibBEYa2xf_hNw.text: I absolutely love this place. Coming here will be tradition every time I am in AZ!!! I love the food the ambiance and the service. The brews are outstanding.. Like holy shit.. Good.

HKN1edz-VrLN2hcQuBJzfA.text: It's hard to choose just one with the variety of pasty's they make! Wonderful crispy flakey pastry with fresh flavor combos inside. Definitely a place to work your way through the menu.

sf9dr5xgI1uoDuXfCC0vjw.text: We went here for lunch before the Cubs/DBacks game and I ordered the Shepherd's Pie with minted lamb while my husband ordered the Cajun Chicken pasty. Both were excellent and filling. The sauce/gravy were both perfect for the dish. The only change I would recommend would be a side of vegetables or something.

RTUX6bs7-6ci_pTEFMzR7A.text: This place is great. Always a good atmosphere. They have meals for my friends who are allergic to beef and chicken and have vegan dishes. There's literally something for everyone. The downtown location has 3 floors which is cool.  I usually get the chicken tikka masala  and wash it down with an IPA. Great service with a smile.

kJob3LkenYk7FfeXc_D9jQ.text: Dark historic building, laid back almost English Pub vibe. Great service and simplicity. Pick your Pasty, no substitutions. Have a beer. Try the tandoori wings. I always gravitate to the Lamb Vindaloo; but it's hard to find a bad one in the bunch.

Z3IKVFcD1N5Myyt9dYWMBQ.text: We recently hosted our company holiday party at the downtown location and had a truly AWESOME experience! The event coordinator Aaron was so great, he went above and beyond to ensure the food was perfect, the bartenders were prepped and we had everything we needed the entire evening. The staff was wonderful, very accommodating and quick to get drinks made for 50+ people! I would highly recommend this venue for any event you may be hosting! Our holiday party was a smash and it was largely due to an awesome host, amazing staff, and of course, delicious food.

uIcPNdzdIG4xdGaOAXkJXw.text: The most delicious place to eat in downtown Phoenix. The atmosphere is super hipster, laid back, with a touch of historic Irish decor. My co-workers and I have frequented this place for happy hours and lunch. The veggie Greek pasty and a side of bread is my go-to. I could eat Cornish Pasty everyday.

x1IkCVPjA9Qh5N2Jp2iE5Q.text: Food awesome, atmosphere awesome, service SUCKS....we had some baled guy who looked like he rather be at a funeral...horrible...no personality...too bad...they should fire him....if you don't want to work...let someone work who does....

Rm5QRpF7i0wu9w4SpZNRrw.text: Great taste and unique set up with a hip vibe and great wine, beer, and cocktail selection. Will be returning often!

h4w7oLZ5Zs7joS1Xke5v9w.text: This was my first pasty experience.  I had the meat and cheese pasty.  It was really good.  I'd definitely eat here again.

JtAiTpmJQMkpz_kNOebgig.text: Server didn't come by for 20 minutes. Asked one of the servers if she was our server. She was so rude we left and went elsewhere.

IkXp7D3SqtgRurFLzLInAg.text: I love food but this place had me talking about how much I loved their food!!  I had the pilgrim pasty and the fries with garlic.  Wow!!  I can't wait to go back and try more off the menu.

Otj6RVV997nSnu0saKZn7A.text: Amazing in it's simplicity yet every pasty is remarkably different.  Can't wait to return!

JjqVwNOwWiJZBFLLd8oV-A.text: Stopped by on Friday after the Diamonbacks game with a friend who knew where the place was, I would have never found it on my own.  You go down the stairs to a long narrow room, very dark with booths on one side and tall tables in the middle. There was only one girl handling service so she was swamped. We ordered two of the pastries from themenu, and a beer. The beer arrived. It took 30 minutes for the pastries and one of them was not what was ordered. The waitress apologized and took it back. We waited another 35 minutes for the correct one to arrive. By then the place was packed and so noisy that it was hard to hear. The manager came over an apologized, saying the waitress was doing her best but she was all alone on the floor. He said, and did, take one of the pastries off the bill. I told him it was not necessary but it was removed. Nice guy, with a goal to have a successful downtown restaurant, cannot fault him for that. The acoustics are bad as all the surfaces are hard and the sound just bounces off and around. Everyone there was having a great time, that is for sure. It is a popular place and seemed to have a loyal following. I am happy to see downtown businesses doing well. The food was OK, not much more. Seems this is a place to meet friends, have drinks, a bit of fool and a lot of loud, noisy conversation. I liked the place, but it is not for me, but for young folks, go and have fun.

Jh8f3I-NWZpbS-nA5DiWpA.text: Only 2 stars because I liked the ambiance of the bar, if it were strictly about the food I wouldn't even give it a 1/2. Not that the food tasted nasty, or gross, it's just that there was no taste! My wife had the  Chicken Greek Pastie which thankfully had sun-dried tomatoes and olives to provide flavor. I had the Roast Dinner which based on the ingredients, I had high hopes for. Sadly there was no flavor in ANY of the ingredients. It honestly tasted like a boiled roast and potatoes, with NO seasonings added. No broth, No salt, No pepper, No bullion, and the roast beef was dry. I try to judge a plate or a meal on its own in my first 3 or 4 bites and then utilize the dipping sauces. The horseradish cream and red wine gravy were good which help salvage some of the experience, but I wasn't looking for a meal of side sauces to fulfill my appetite. Overall, very disappointing experience. The Scotch Egg was average, again minimal flavor in the egg and having to rely on the dipping sauce for any taste. Would not recommend this place for the food.  I really wanted to like it here, but just having a hard time falling for the place.

2noQWnzA69ldc4s5a6hGrw.text: I love Cornish Pasty, doesn't matter which location, the food is always great. When I get take out for home, I stick with Oggies and Pilgrim pasties. But a couple of friends recently moved here and this is a regular meet up spot for us and we even celebrated our birthdays here on a Monday night.  Other great savory pasties I have enjoyed are the Guinness beef stew, Shepard's Pie, Cottage Pie and breakfast all day.  Desserts here are huge and can be shared by 3-4 people. My favorites are the Banoffee Pie (not for those who hate whipped cream), sticky toffee pudding, and apple pasty. The PBJ pasty is also good but I don't usually go for that flavor for dessert, might make a good breakfast? Skip the chocolate bread pudding, its pretty dry.  Whatever you do, order the Transatlantique Lambic Kriek beer!! I don't drink beer at all, but I am in love with this one.

h_oee5Y200GmtP9n3YfH6Q.text: 3 floors and outdoor seating to this pasty specialty and tap beer restaurant/bar. Bartender Sean took such good care of us. He recommended beers and even split a huge Shepherds pasty, one half for now and the other half  to-go for later. Very satisfying and filling. Beautiful Phoenix night. Fun and yummy food. They also have wings, greek spinach snacks and other tasty appetizers. Desserts, too.

GfKH09gJSN2uWXMa85ugTA.text: I absolutely love this place and didn't realize they had one downtown. I normally go to the one in Tempe but this place is just as good. I was really intrigued with the way this building was set up. It's a two level building and on the second floor they have a place we're you can shoot some pool or play darts. It's pretty spacious and I could imagine coming back with a group of friends for happy hour too shoot some pool. Other then that, their Pasties are the shit!!! I've had a plethora of pasties from here and I don't have a single complaint. My favorite ones are the Chicken Pot Pie, Italian, Carne Adovada, and The Royale with cheese. Excuse me for moment as I wipe the drool on the side of my mouth. Lol. Their service is also outstanding and often come check up on you to see if everything is ok. Kuddos!

IcQmFLu7QtAB_J7p7d3uFQ.text: Food is on point customer service horrible. No one cares about anything there. You are looked down upon...employees look like you ruined their day when you show up. No one is helpful not sure what the issue is...

Had the Lamb Vingaloo, very spicy so if you don't like spice beware. The only downfall was the parking. I needed to keep fillin the meter, besides that I would recommend this location if ya just wanna hang with friends.

pFfP0RbjQhQfzCuH4uadZw.text: Pros: Decor is super cool, various areas to hangout and enjoy a meal  Cons: been telling my gf about this place for months...server took our drink and food orders and after that we never saw em again. We had a few comaints about the food but after 20 minutes of nobody showing up I figured I would ballpark our tab and we decided to head over to Rokerij/Richardsons to start the night over.
