-oSdkxxeoRk_ZP85rul2fw.text: Great draft beer selection with local AZ brews available. We went during dinner and found seating on the first floor. Service was busy but still attentive. They gave us all separate checks without any issues. Prices are very reasonable... 20oz drafts for $7!

UPv7ijdlGvPFF3dFtEYYbA.text: Food was good. We will try something else the next time. We liked our food but will need to look for something that will fit us better.

v4ORmzXhuWm4s767_zdl7Q.text: Pah-stee. Rhymes with classy. Or sassy. Not pay-stee. We r in PHX in the 112deg furnace. But THEY are baking pasties in the 112 deg furnace - rock on!  We chose to sit upstairs...in air cond!!! The place is very well ventilated so it was super comfortable temp-wise. Lots of flavors to choose from. Hmmm. Lots of rib-sticking savory flavs. So i chose Greek spanokopita mini-pasties fm appetizer menu. DH chose Italian. Ok. The crust is the key. Oooh they are on key! Flaky & tender. The spinach & feta is fresh w side of thick tzaziki. Our lovely server offers a side of marinara as she likes it. Perfect. Makes it almost like a spinach lasagna. So i had two cuisines in one dish. Btw, the little envelopes hold their heat! Hot hot hot. Which is a good thing for food!

VLbV8JD3A7TJBLv9HcV9IA.text: What is a pasty? DELICIOUSNESS! Had the veggie pesto chicken, so good. The "chicken" was made from Quorn, which I had never heard of, but was amazing. Down to earth staff, super friendly. Would eat again.

EJ9vhWpELCNy2X0MD-FxuA.text: Took some coworkers here who had never been to Cornish Pasty.   We sat downstairs in what used to be the old Monroe's bar.  Which is always a happy trip down memory lane.  I nerded out on everyone and explained the story behind the pasty.  Our food took a lil while to get to us do to lunch rush hitting.  To be expected downtown.  I had the vegan vindaloo and it was so delicious.  Another coworker got the Italian and she loved it.   All in all everyone had a good experience and loved the downstairs cozy atmosphere.

hn8XeINTDChVkXMYn0DrVg.text: Went in with a couple of friends, and other than a few menus we never saw our waiter. We tried flagging her down but I guess she was too busy talking with other tables. Not sure what the food tastes like or even quality because we never made it that far. After 20 minutes we decided to walk out. Just simply did not live up to the hype. The owner should seriously consider actively training their staff. Cannot express what a real letdown this was

I6TfuNcN35porguSmjpTww.text: Amazing pastry! Great food! Open late and the food is very fresh' I had the pot pie my BF had the Rueben. Both were fantastic. With the pot pie the give you a little side of gravy it's really good but for reason they serve the gravy cold. Will definitely return!

WWpmwvP1H8C_y_17CXMq7g.text: Keeping this review short and simple. This place is a great place to either have lunch, dinner or just have drinks. The option to pick from the 3 levels and all of them having a different vibe is a great touch. Food is always great and consistent. Bartenders (Eddie and Chris) and others are always ready to serve. Servers are also great. Just a great place to eat, chill and hangout whether it's a weekday or weekend. Keep up the great work guys!

QRdy_FWmc0cYbMRlbc4SXQ.text: We loved the food here. We tried Greek Chicken Pasty and Pesto Chicken Pasty for two consecutive nights. I highly recommend this place.

Fc-4FopsN4GId4X8z57-xg.text: So everybody knows the food is great here. No doubt about that. What really gets me about this place is the atmosphere, the service, and the consistency of experience. Staff member offered to dim the lights when she noticed I was squinting to look at the menu. Music was perfect. When's the last time you've heard Devendra Banhart being played in a restaurant? Never for me, so it was a pleasant surprise. Second floor offers views of the street, first floor offers patio seating and views of the kitchen, and basement level offers leather booths with plenty of dark corners. Something for everyone!

auDg99ukvlLpvsFDk2P7Jw.text: I never bothered going out of my way to Tempe since I knew this would open here. It just took forever! Like YEARS of anticipation. So...does it live up to the hype? Yeah, kinda, enough to be a happy return customer.   CPC's draw is an abundance of stuffed pastries that give diners dozens of choices. They range from the traditional, with stuff like roast beef or hamburger with gravy. But that's a snooze. I like the southwestern varieties like Cajun Chicken, Chicken Tikka Masala, and even their vegan meals, which I believe was some type of veggie vindaloo. My only complaint: the slightly sweet dough tries to be one-size fits all, but misses the mark. There's something about the bread that can work great with chicken and peppers, but can totally miss when fused with other styles of cuisine. It's not a big deal.  They're all much more filling than they appear. There's something for everyone. It's good. Whatever you order, start of with their wings. They are *huge*, the 'HP sauce' is delicious, and I just can't get enough of the Stilton sauce. My friend swears by the pate if that's your thing.  Aside from dining, keep in mind there are 3 floors, so it shouldn't be tough finding seating. The basement and second floor have a dive-y feel to them, which is good for socializing when Seamus and Valley Bar are just too loud for ya. To make things better, there's a limited cocktail menu, and a formidable assortment of roughly two dozen beers. You'll need them, as it seems impossible to bring anything out of the kitchen in under a half hour.   Overall, I'm just not seeing a reason to avoid this spot despite a couple of faults. It's one of those few restaurants you can take everyone to, and have your entire group at least content. It's that sort of reliability, along with variety, that will keep me coming back.

hkSkkuPymrowmfFyub6oaA.text: Still underwhelmed. Their menu listed a rotating vegan soup; however the server said they didn't have it. Reminds me of the last time we came here, when they were also out of items. I was really looking forward to getting the peanut butter and jelly pasty for my dessert because the menu indicated you can get it vegan, but the server told us there is no way to make it vegan because it has an egg wash brushed on it.

biqxT5LYgPwL8uK-q5xbkw.text: This place had been highly recommended and my Mom, sister and I went there tonight. The waitress had an attitude from the moment we got there. It was very noisy and the music they played unless you are a heavy metal rocker was not pleasant to eat while listening. We ordered, it took the food 20 minutes to get there. There was a mix up and the waitress comes by to let us know she had ordered my food wrong and they were preparing it. She then asked if I would like a side salad, and I said yes. My Mom and sister were done when my food arrived. The waitress never came back to check on us, and then cleaned up the plates from my Mom and sister. I felt rushed. She finally came back and brought our check, to which I asked if she comped mine, to which she said no, she comped me a salad. After I asked for it to be.comped, she stormed off shaking her head. She never did ask how our food was and she overall was extemely rude.  The food was ok, however, the service was horrible!

wfkgUhqHaaND2qIwd9CQOg.text: Amazing restaurant, 3 levels with their own bar. They offer a variety of delicious party's to choose from as well as a great selection of beers on tap.

S1C8xCHXlsTaQn7AxQkOcA.text: You can never go wrong with the Chicken Pot Pie pasty. This is my go to and I love pairing it with their wine options. Make sure when you go to visit the bottom floor for a drink.

YQ_yl1rLQ-dM_xXyLEWkJw.text: We stopped for lunch and was totally impressed. From the staff to the food it was easily one of the best experiences we have had since moving to AZ. I would highly recommend trying this pub out. Great food!

DFkEEZrwZlTfaw1qv2C97A.text: What a great surprise.  The pastry is excellent and it wraps around just about any kind of flavors that you like.  I enjoyed Marcella my wife enjoyed turkey dinner and my mother joined us and ate every bit of her Greek way. Very good value

GwEgVZZbSIkj0Z6m9sWpRQ.text: So good. Words cannot describe the euphoria. Guinness stew pasty was amazing. Spouse had the peppered steak. Also delicious. Great environment. Will definitely come back.

rZvn-Ofy4WfGTutxusjVBw.text: So glad it's FINALLY open after waiting so long. The building is gorgeous inside and out. Was a little disappointed though. We were given a full menu, then a soft opening printed out menu with limited pasties available. I asked if the pasty I wanted was available and it wasn't. So I picked another one and my friend picked his off the same menu. I asked when will the full menu be available?  She said they've run out of things since they've been so busy. **I hate this excuse, you knew you were going to be slammed as hell, people have been waiting and waiting for this location to open; why wasn't enough inventory ordered to deal with the deluge of customers and orders you know you'll encounter? We ordered our drinks and chatted etc, 25 min pass and the bartender comes over and says to my friend they're out of the pasty he ordered. So he had to pick another one real quick. Why weren't we told this 25 min ago? We were thinking our food would have been coming out shortly. We waited over an hour and finally had our food show up. We were upstairs and it wasn't packed. Soft opening or not. Hopefully all pasties will be available soon and not running out again. The pasties were good when they arrived. I had the Reuben, was glad to see homemade 1000 island, my friend the meatball. The meatballs were extremely salty though. Definitely to much added to the batch. We got our check and we were charged for the Peppered steak pasty on top of the other two so had to tell the bartender we never received the peppered one since you said it was 86'd. This new location is going to be very busy so I look forward to a lil better experience next time like I've had at the Tempe and Mill Ave location.

urdUb-Acfve6859WOndaRA.text: I was told the food is made every morning. I am seriously doubting that they make 40+ variations of these every morning. I had an " original" steak and potato, very bland and a little burnt. It also took 20 minutes, which is long to sit and wait. Service was so-so, maybe average. If your're drunk at 1 a.m. this is the place, if you're sober eat somewhere else!

lEYHcC9-cEOqbxYGPRIvdw.text: It's like going to a pub, the food is like hangover food, but noting to write home about. For the price, it wasn't all that much food, we left hungry and the only good thing were the expensive drinks. Also note when other say it's not good for kids. Just don't bother taking your kids, they do not have a kids menu (come on how hard is it to nuke chicken fingers) and their regular menu is not conducive to little noes. Maybe older kids, but not toddlers.

vT9n_lQnLKvmdQW85HpLbw.text: Feel free to eat here if you want to feel like an inconvenience. Honestly the worst service I've ever experienced. The bartenders don't seem to understand that they're working for tips.

dgqaXziTaWCcE5WdoCf0uA.text: Horrible service! The bartender was rude and acted like she owned the place! I WILL NEVER GO BACK.

CpN3l-ECz1Nvfv9iRhblqg.text: I grew up eating pastys, prepared by my Grandmother and Mother.  The food served here is every bit as good as those wonderful meals from years ago.   6 of us visited this location for lunch, everyone of us had a delightful lunch regardless of what we ordered.  I an sure that you would be hard pressed to find a Cajun or Mexican pasty in Cornwall or Wales, they are excellent entrees served here.   Advice:  Allow time for baking the Pastys, I not sure of the logistics at CPC, but it takes some time to bake a pasty even if prepared ahead.  This is not Subway, add that they recently opened and are still making changes to the building service will be slower than a Fast food place.   Yes, Pastys are a lot of dough, and it's substantial.  It needed to hang together being carried down into a tin or coal mine.  An 'official' pasty is closed on the side rather than the top, and this rim is used as a handle and not usually eaten.  CPC closes dinner pastys on top and dessert ones on the side, Mom's were always the opposite.  One suggestion, pre-cook or use fully ripe apples, they were a little under done. This is really good food, eat in or takeout.   Plan ahead to leave enough time to enjoy you meal, or order to go and finish baking at home.  Really great food!!!

yaU6Rw1w_oMPFPSED4BnEQ.text: I was headed to another restaurant when I saw this one and immediately decided I was going to try it. The atmosphere was great, an old world feel- the decor and set up was truly unique. I went upstairs to find more seating and 2 pool stables. I couldn't decide what I wanted to try (the pasties all looked so good) so I got 1 and my brother got one and we split them. They both were amazing- the Ruben and the Carne Adovada (was a bit spicy but I love spicy foods). The crust was thin and crispy and the fillings tasted homemade. They also had some craft beers, I didn't have one but my brother had an IPA and said it was really good. If we weren't at an event I would have brought one home-- you can get it half baked to finish cooking at home. I believe if you get the Oggie you even get a small discount if it's take and bake. Overall I loved this place and will have to find a reason to go back downtown just so I can eat here.

WPHvYEpZPcu-KMH9P3EPSg.text: Great food, great service. Staff is very friendly and the tunes were awesome. Three level restaurant and every level has its only little vibe. The lounge is my personal favorite, but their street level bar where your able to watch the cooks make the pasties is a close second.

m-YUgAiUu-3KU1lMv_HtdA.text: It isn't often I'm so compelled to write a review but after having read everything else it goes without saying. This is by far the most authentic pasty shop in all of the US if not the world. The wisdom they displayed in serving their pasty in the Cornish manner is astounding to me. Upon the first bite I was rushed back to my childhood and reminded as a food historian this is truly what's worth preserving. Not many people are daring enough to put the crease of a pasty on the top. The margarine and salt used was spot on in 1905 when the pasty became an International symbol of Cornish. The price was slightly higher then I would have imagined however, prices at this fine establishment are actually done in pounds sterling keeping with the authentic experience of eating a pasty. Well worth it! Simply delightful.

J7rK5O2WvdbkOC7UycFGJQ.text: Unfortunately the whole experience is impacted by the gross homeless Young man casually laying outside the door in a sleeping bag with a box of food on the ground that he was nibbling from As if he was in the comfort of his own living room. He was dirty disheveled stinky so it was gross walking by him walking into the restaurant as we left the restaurant he was still there gross and stinky. I don't know why the restaurant does not insist that he not sleep in front of their door during business hours. This was 6 PM in the evening. It Really adds  to the creep factor when you go in and out of the restaurant. The food is great but the ambience is ruined by the gross stinky person literally lounging/sleeping on the sidewalk in a sleeping bag at 6 pm eating from a carton of food off the ground Asking for money. Unfortunately this will be the demise of our downtown restaurants if they don't do something about it. If you like to visit Cornish pasty  Company I suggest a different location.

TfN2TtmnNKgtP4j7n9tlcw.text: We were so excited to try this downtown location, because we love the Tempe spot, but we were left very disappointed and physically ill. We waited 10 min for water, then a new waitress appeared to take care of us. She let us know that this wasn't her area and she's only here helping out due to being short staffed. No big deal. We waited another 10 min for water and 10 for the two drinks we ordered. They seemed to be out of a lot- lemonade, beers, vegan Pasties. Again, not a big deal. We waited 30 min for our food and when we got it they didn't give us silverware. We waited 10 min with hot food in front of us for the waitress to come back with only 2 sets (there were 5 of us). We dug in anyway, and it wasn't until we were 3/4 of the way done that we got the other 3 sets of silverware. On top of it all, 3 of us came down with severe food poisoning. We didn't eat anywhere else, so it had to have been from here.

svSEmLOIFyfMkA64TigRUw.text: Over an hour wait at lunchtime. I'm glad they're popular but they have to figure something out - people need to get to work.  15 minutes before anyone even came to the table and other 15 to get drinks. And then the food didn't come for a full hour. Food was fine but definitely not worth the wait.

EdGTVEwkPqJXY5jPqmcMzw.text: The food is phenomenal, hands down! Love the atmosphere, from the pool tables upstairs to the old Italian booth seating in the dungeon. There are bars located on all 3 floors, super convenient and should make things go smoothly. It definitely has an edgy vibe, with interior and most guests doting black, slight goth meets new English pub. The pilgrim is a must try on the menu, also the chicken pot pie will make you feel like your home. I give four stars simply because of the service. While I attended the soft opening and after several times, I was highly disappointed in the service. Granted, I've taken into account soft openings and openings in general, but it seemed as though most of these servers/bartenders didn't have a clue as to how you  actually serve patrons. From having staff just stare at me when I come in without speaking, to being completely forgotten about at a table and having to ask for someone else to bring drinks, silverware and eventually food, amongst other things that aren't necessary to explain. It's a great place, decor, food, liveliness, but the staff sure needs some training in plain old customer service. Will I go back? Yes, because the food is that brilliant.

CigBcvDbTYSvHJZax6Qg7A.text: Waited a long time to go here. Food and drinks are always good. Sometimes you have to wait a bit but I expect that. What I don't expect is when some entitled people come in just like other places downtown and throw a fit when things are set in front of them right away.  Last night had to listen to this obnoxious man(being nice about it) complain he had to wait for his food. It takes time to cook something unless it's pre-made! What this place does need is a bouncer at the door to kick people like that out so the staff doesn't get frazzled and everyone else can enjoy.

wggDWkYnDPYuaV_GYZkx7w.text: Was staying close by to the Cornish Pasty and have heard many great things of this place.  Myself and a couple others chose to try this place out as it was close to where we were, and it didn't disappoint.  We had gotten to the restaurant before the theater crowd showed up, sat downstairs and it felt like a True British Pub.   Shortly after getting our beverages, it started to get a little busy, yet the wait staff couldn't have been more professional and on point, especially since it appeared many of the patrons were on a time limit.  I ordered the Bangers and Mash pasty, along with Salt & Pepper Chips (fries) the pasty was awesome, while the fries fell just a little short of True English style chips.  One of my companions ordered a salad, and the other ordered a different type of pasty. Needless to say, we all did a pretty good job devouring our food.  I would definitely go back and order a different type of pasty as the food was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bangers &amp; Mash pasty; Guinness beverage and Chips.

lSq3Fhw_T8F8DbTKEAYubw.text: "Eating out doesn't have to be a formula. Eating out is about having fun. I get really frustrated when it's badly done."  Gordon Ramsay  Wow, what a location! We managed to snag a sweet spot in the upstairs loft by the windows that look out into Downtown Phoenix. Eleven of us squeezed ourselves into two church pews and a table. We had Oven Chips (one garlic and one jalapeno, the garlic fries were better), a Cobb Salad, and ten different kinds of pasties. Scooby Doo shots were had (Thanks, Simona!), cocktails were stiff, waters were filled, and food was demolished.  Cornish Pasty throughout the valley is pretty consistent but this location might edge out the rest from the views alone.  It's super dark inside as per usual and many of us blind bats had to rely on our phones to light up our menus but hey, it's all good.  Some of my favorites are the Shepherd's Pie, The Pilgrim, and Roast Dinner.  The Italian is also a great alternative to a calzone if you're in the mood for a cheese bomb.  Whatever you choose, I'm sure it will be an amazing bite.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roast Dinner... again!
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roast Dinner.
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ambiance.

LmNm0UtCGOL_I3b8KlIfXQ.text: Great late-night food! We stopped in after festivities on a Saturday night and I was so glad that we did! I ordered the sausage salad (it was HUGE) and my boyfriend had a pasty. Both were great and was so much better than what I was expecting considering it was after midnight on a weekend. Will definitely come back and will check out the other locations. 10/10!

JGYePbBf48OWBub0NGRoQQ.text: This place is absolutely delicious love the concept and it was a completely different experience one that I've never had before I highly McCormack

H9DSycjK6wdSN4ZlQEzFew.text: The food here is killer! Great late night or lunch spot. Great food, service and atmosphere (as long as you are prepared for hard drinking big eating patrons).   I've had a ton of the Pastys. I've sampled more than 20 different kinds. Never ask the server / bartender which are their favorite because there are too many killer patsys- spanning different flavors - and countries. I genuinely like almost every one I've tasted. Don't ask the server which are their favorite - it's impossible to answer. Ask the server which they don't like - which will likely equal one or two out of 45.   Literally 25 of the 30 meat based pastys on the menu are insane!!!  Please try everything that looks good to you. The only things I didn't like were some of the apps.   The pasty rock!!!

EzN8AwIHHIBjDbLzIwdGXw.text: Tasty food. $23. for a pasty and a glass of cider. Indifferent service.

YzWRy6elORnCCTUZZ5HPrA.text: Delicious food in a fun, authentic-like British Pub. Great selection of beer on tap. Our bartender was great! We sat at the outdoor bar on the sidewalk and it was perfect! Pasties are made right near the bar so we got to see how much love & labor go into making them and it made us appreciate them even more!! Definitely going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cajun chicken, Italian, Rueben.

Bw7t1uM35bEevQvisRfXxw.text: I'm a visitor from LA.  Hi, Phoenix people.  I make it a point to stop by a Cornish Pasty Co at least once every trip and I'm leaving a 5 star review at this particular branch because this one I had were the best tasting ones and the employees were awesome.  Seems like I went during an off-hour timing since it wasn't that busy and everyone was very chill.  The nice servers really tried to keep me feeling at home. (I think the Scottsdale and a few locations have really awesome servers as well!)  This location was the one that really made me wish one like this one existed in DTLA or Culver City. (which would fit in really nicely)  Anyways, keep on doing whacha'll doin.  The pasties are amazing.  Especially the non-traditional ones.  They reheat well so I enjoy keeping a couple extra in the hotel room when I'm way too tired but I need dinner.  I even brought a few back to LA and probably will do so again soon, hopefully. :)

fZ9-B62TqsVGOGF0tH1zpQ.text: This was such a pleasant surprise.  We came downtown to check out the St. Paddy day party but from what we could see and here it wasn't looking good so decided to pop in here for a drink.  I honestly would never search out English food (I mean, come on!  The English aren't exactly known for great food!) but these pasty things were so stinking good!  There were 3 of us and we shared 2 and some fries which was plenty of food.  We had the New Mexico one and the special that day which was corned beef.  Seriously the pastry was so good and the filling so yummy.  If I were back in Phoenix I would definitely go back and try another one!

EsImz1BPKwqij9eWAg_Zsw.text: Welll 5 stars because its THE BOMBZ ...Hot, Fresh Food n I luv the music ok about the food....Artichoke soup Is Life!!! Any pasty you get will be Amazing trust me...I come here alottt play pool and there is a dart thing lol service is good if ya in a rush go fast food..if you want to sit n talk have a cool conversation with ya date come here!!!!! Been here about 6x so far get my same soup always different pastys... From a Foodmama

Bl75uqexifEkbngqXMhb5A.text: The food is AWESOME!!! The service is ridiculous. The servers are busy talking amongst themselves or missing in action. If you love pasties and are in no hurry to get your order taken or your drink refilled or get your bill, hit this place up!

pJCbdpe_kfF9XlrMpocsYg.text: The pasty is filling. It does take about 15 min for them to get it ready when you order one to go. They might run out of a certain pasty. It may take more time to make new ones if they run out. It is a nice place to go with friends.

7mRx-nzndnLf7gUDQzO-hA.text: So few restaurants do what this restaurant does, your mouth explodes from all the savory flavor in every bite. We had the Salmon Pasty and Carne asada adobaba Pasty with a P platter that brought it all together. They have many flavors of local beers on tap and a variety of different atmospheres to indulge your mood. A multi level for every occasion.    Come relaxed or be a high end hipster, it's your Call. You will love this place.   Don't be afraid to try something new, oh and bring a few friends.

I've tried several of their pasties, so far none to complain about. My goal is to ultimately try them all. See you in 300 lbs!  My husband always gets the same one, The Oggie. And I always wind up wanting a couple fat bites of his. It really is a classic. In the meantime, I'll continue my quest of polishing off their entire menu. Wish me luck.

wSB9tWga1ug0LrV9LxNq8g.text: Very casual atmosphere. Great selection of beers. Huge selection of pasties. Service is a little slow and hands off, but not rude. Major props for actually being open past 9pm, an apparent rarity in Phoenix. My chicken tikka masala pasty was a little bit dry and could have used a more generous cup of yogurt sauce, but it was perfectly spiced and packed with filling.

vU75gBgbgXABTIQU0MmvCQ.text: This place came highly recommended by a few friends so when meeting for dinner with friends while visiting Phoenix I had to check it out.  The restaurant itself is really kool the inside set up of upstairs and downstairs creates a kool vibe. When we first got there we we told to seat ourselves.  We were still waiting for someone so we just ordered waters to start. In the beginning me and my friends kinda got an icey vibe from the waitress.  I'm happy to say though that did change.  We ended up ordering drinks and the drink I wanted wasn't available.  I'm super weird about trying new things but the Ace space blood orange ale I ordered was great. I'm a picky eater and was hesitant at first because everything is premixed and the 5 or 6 options I wanted all had something in them I can't eat. But I found an option that would work and I was able to pick out the mushrooms.  I ended up ordering the pesto chicken pastry.  Let me tell you every bite of this was heaven on a plate. For desert I ordered the bonoffe pie but with no whip cream.  It was delicious.    When I travel I love to try out new places and places I can't eat at back home.  However I did find out they have a Vegas location as well and I was happy to hear so. I will be checking the Vegas location out soon.

C6rFSK-iIgophF61vuLk6w.text: Nice place for an evening out!  Its name might lead you to think it's like a take out shop, but it's very much a pub with really good savory pies! My South African husband gave it a thumbs up as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Loved this place!

fCKyQRM-39L9SUTfj0jN4A.text: Walking back from a business meeting we stumbled by this restaurant which was close to our hotel.    Walked in and went up stairs to get seats.  Walked up the stairs and saw they got billards on the second floor.  Pretty nifty.    Ordered "The Oggy", which was a crispy tasty pastry stuffed with sliced potatoes, chopped steak, and sauce on the side. Also, I ordered a Guinness to accompany the oggy pastry as well. Delish!  Btw , they got a few selection of IPA for those that are IPA drinkers.

04KXhr4gTyc0kYsZ4mWb1w.text: This place was awesome! Three stories of seating options, great drink selection and tasty food. We had a few sour beers which is nice because these can be tricky to find. The bar staff was friendly and attentive.   My guy ordered a pasty and truly difficult to decide on which one as the possibilities are endless. I had a chicken tikka salad. I wasn't sure how that would turn out, but I was pleasantly surprised. My salad was filled with fresh ingredients and the chicken was perfect.  Overall we really enjoyed all the dinner and drink options so much to choose from. We had a great experience and will definitely be back.

UCrjt5FIdVdL9NlYKVSiLQ.text: My Wife and I love Cornish Pasty, but we're a bit disappointed by this location. The service was very slow and inattentive. My drink was empty more than it was full and there were long periods without seeing the server. The food was good as always, just very slow to arrive.

9Pwd0drtao0mPHJL1wgXwQ.text: So sad.... sat at bar how far it has fallen....ordered tandori wings and chicken tikka pastie with side of garlic mash with cheese......   wings reheated dry spice was way off and unpleasant.  30 plus mins later pastie arrives ok garlic mash full of black bad potatoe. Back of house cleanliness just awful, staff making too many adjustments to clothing and self then putting hands back into ingreadients....will not return and as a brit in phoenix that hurts.......service bad food plates and bowls served with food particles on them from other dishes... expediter last line of quality check ..... FAIL day of service wed lunch day of this review

25LASb4OF_nkuPlHlhJpfw.text: I thought this place was quite fun and unique. I had the rosemary chicken pasty, and while it was good, I found that I wasn't crazy about it with the brie cheese. Other members of my party had a wide selection of the pasties, and overall we were very happy. Portion size of the pasty is quite generous, and I believe most, if not all, come with a dipping sauce.   The beer selection was great. The only disappointment was they did not have black current to do a traditional "cider and black" from England.   Overall, definitely worth a visit for locals and non-locals.

WDBMx2pSE-8mqPOtgjyGKQ.text: Wow, so tasty and cannot wait to go back and get many other pasty's on the menu!  Love the three floors of the restaurant and the ambiance is amazing at downtown location, love it!  Look forward to going back with friends to introduce them to this great place too!

5O4eBaU9cM4qG5oLW2mg2A.text: Clearly was made fun of for being a trans individual.  I expected more out of people downtown.  Let down.

ha9XS5G3Uy7J509uh8KXOA.text: Where do I start?! This place is three floors of amazingness. Downstairs is a dark and gloomy seductive pub the middle floor is open air and upstairs is a great pool area. I love this location so much more than the Tempe one, all sorts of fun and the same great food! You have to check it out and make sure you get a pasty they are phenomenal!

joDxnKKY2h-i9GiF4p4Vrw.text: Love them. Go there all the time. The food is always amazing. I always make sure to take out of town guests there. The unfiltered blood orange cider was phenomenal!

aGXd-ObTawncCOzIxiaPQA.text: This place was delicious and felt like walking into a british pub but with groovy open windows open to the sun. I had a Cubano Cornish pastie. It was divine. Also got a scotch egg .. also good. The service was a little slow but the seats were comfy. Delighted to find a place that's focused on this little known delicious element of british food and yup I'm british avd these pasties are the real deal.

89jiuJTnBCP1Ggdu9_hRrg.text: DELICIOUS food, craft cocktails, and fun vibe. I was surprised with how many vegetarian and vegan friendly options there were!

pMgJu2wP2LVDacrL6wMK0g.text: The pilgrim. Always get it with extra cranberry and gravy. You'll thank me later. Just remember that you don't go to this place if you want to make your movie time in 30 minutes. Enjoy the experience.

vc6zbEFn9rND1-qaQZA9eQ.text: This place is one of a kind and it is awesome!  I am a pescetarian so I was pleased to see so many hearty vegetarian options for me.  I tried the vegetarian cottage pie and it was delicious.  I don't like meat (other than seafood), but I am often envious of my husband when he gets entrees such as beef wellington or pot pies when we dine out.  I enjoy those hearty types of meals at times, but they are hard to find without meat.  I have been wanting to get back here to try one of the many other vegetarian pasty selections from the menu.  This location itself is very large and offers alcoholic beverages and billiards as well.  It has the feel of an English pub which I love!

4UcohPpL2IyME1-RAMxACQ.text: I've been here several times. Always go upstairs. Friend had a going away party downstairs. Bartender was horrible. Greeted me with 'you want something?' Every time I've been downstairs, only ones down there. You'd think he's happy for the business. Not so much. Didn't eat tonight. Food is great, downstair guy sucks.

OYjthiAIp7uvCYykWfSxCw.text: Most of their pasties that I have tried were very good. My favorite is the peppered steak. I would have given this place 4 stars, but my experience at this location was disappointing to say the least.   I called in for pick up at 12. Person said it would be ready in 15 minutes. I got there around 12:25, which means my food should be ready to go.   Asked the waitress if this was where I picked up. She said it is, hold up. I wait on her. Then she give me my check and I sign for it. She then completely ignores the fact that I am even there, attending to everyone else, while I'm still clueless to where my order is.   I wait another ten minutes before I stop her and asked if my order was ready and she goes and check. I noticed upon arrival that there was a to go order in a black bag sitting there. The guy sitting next to the bag told me it's been sitting there for a while. She then tells me that order was mine. Had I not said anything, I would have still been there waiting not knowing when or where my order was.   What's the point of a to go order if it's as slow as if I was dining there?   Aside from that, the food isn't bad. And the gravy on top of the pasty just adds that much more flavor.   The atmosphere provides a great little hangout spot on the second floor. Pool, darts, bar, and tables accompanied by the church-like seating.

0zfHuj9CqUPCRsewzZp0Gw.text: Don't let the homeless guys sleeping on the sidewalk scare you away. The pastys are comfort food at it's finest & totally affordable. No tv's so you either have to resort to staring at your phone or socializing & playing pool. Appears to be a great late night spot as well. Guiness stew pasty w/ red wine gravy is out of this world. And if you go here for lunch, well I took a 4 hour nap right after so there's that. Andrew (or Anthony? ) behind the bar was fantastic at making you feel at home and reeling in a new regular. Can't wait to come back

jREO8Zhk3Wu-r_LpwwqdDw.text: Update: the owner of this restaurant reached out to me to let me know that they have been working to improve their service and have made significant changes since my visit. I appreciate an owner who reached out to customers and I hope he has improved this location. +1*  Maybe it's me. I have tried several of the Pasty locations and haven't really loved any of them. This one, though, was particularly bad. Granted, I went here with a friend shortly after they opened, so maybe that was part of the problem. We arrived late -ish (around 9 pm). We ordered a Royale with Cheese at the suggestion of our waitress and a couple of beers. We then proceeded to sit there for over 2 hours. 2 HOURS! What happened? Apparently, they gave our food to someone else and didn't realize it. Then they ran out of premade Royale with Cheese Pasties and had to make a new one (or something). I have no idea, but we wasted our whole night sitting there. Then when we finally received the food, it wasn't good. It was super greasy. Not only that, but I wanted a different sauce to go with it and no one came to ask if we needed anything. Let me remind you, we had been sitting there waiting for 2 HOURS and then no one came to ask how the food was or to see if we needed anything...... that is insane. I just ate the greasy pasty without a sauce. The waitress ended up comping the pasty (but not the beers), so that was ok..... I mean, really I feel like they should have comped the entire meal given that their errors interrupted any plans we may have had that night, and their service was so non existent, we couldn't even cancel the order and leave.   PS the decor is nice enough, they have a decent patio, and their beer list was alright (though their draft beers were a bit pricier than other places around town).

Wk8ZJOYqZfWmcCxiyNDMSg.text: I love the food and have come here often, however I'm kind of sick of being burned. If you don't have salmon filets available for the evening, it would be nice to let your patron know instead of serving chopped up fish. It's a different experience and I would've just omitted it from my order and ordered another drink or mashed potatoes. But I don't waste food and won't send it back so here we are.   Please 86 something when you're out. Thank you.

0R3Q-fZod1R-BkJxeEIgSg.text: Nice atmosphere with lots of people. Some people don't like British food, but I enjoy it. It takes awhile to get your food, but if you call ahead for take out, they get it to you quickly. The only issue I have with this location is the lack of parking. It's the same as anywhere in downtown Phoenix.

N-drKd50STc2R9SycqZ7_Q.text: This place is heaven!  I had the porky, which was so dang good.  It was fun to sit at the bar and watch them make pasties while I waited for my food.  Truly homemade food that is super fresh.  I'm glad a friend recommended this establishment to me.  I will be back.  There are so many more things on the menu I want to try.

KZMSLqN8wYOP9hqOgNotxQ.text: We stopped here for dinner and were not disappointed! The service was great and very fast (we told them we were starving, because we had just flown in form Ohio). The place itself is rustic and mismatched and super cool. We sat on the main level in wooden church pews and loved the atmosphere with the bar and hanging lights. And most importantly our food was delicious! They had a ton of vegetarian and vegan options, which we always appreciate. Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6U3gqnqyEwTZ-RNFGK93yQ.text: All around good experience. The energy here is great. The food was amazing. Service was a bit slow but not so much that it interfered with our experience. I would say this may be my new favorite restaurant!  Update: been back twice....yes...this is my new favorite restaurant!

FdMjt-8AjX2xEXPM93RCHw.text: Came on a chilly Sunday (it happens in Phoenix too)!  Has a pub like feel...some outdoor seating available.  Restaurant has downstairs and upstairs as well.  I tried the Guinness Stew and Lamb Vindaloo pastys - both were very delicious, but my favorite was the Guinness Stew.  A Cornish Pasty is a meat pie that you basically eat with your hands.  But there were plenty of vegetarian options as well!

SqzyzekoQFQWEDjq0k8BKg.text: Great location, and the atmosphere was nice. They have 3 bars, one upstairs one downstairs and one when you first walk in. The service from the bartender could have been better.. I waited 15 minutes for a second beer. I would come back, again.

Ss_WDT8GX4MHePH03msUqA.text: We love this place and go as much as we can on weekends. Love the tandoori wings and you will not find a Pasty you won't like. The problem is trying to pick one, they have a huge menu. Great beers on tap too. Large outdoor seating is nice too.

0S0aFdUSN8NZpAS_UB-ijA.text: By far one of my favorite places. Doesn't matter which location you visit, the food is always crazy delicious. Great customer service....sometimes it gets a little slow during the busy times, but they always make up for it by acknowledging it and apologizing for it. They've even offered me a free glass of wine before. They always make sure you leave happy. Love this place!

ZbnO7SKCoKut4RodJw6s5g.text: Phenomenal place to eat.  In town for the NCBA Expo and ended up eating here twice with members of the team.  Three different levels in the place to choose to eat.  Ate once upstairs and then on the street level the second night.  Tons of choices and the pastry was light and filling at the same time. Very filling! Highly recommend oven chips with cheese and jalepenos!  Service was better second night but outstanding place!

epB7k_QI0a2seLgXlZfcCA.text: Baked wings! BAKED WINGS!!! Your parliament wings are amazing! We have loved absolutely everything we have ordered here! Oven chips, mashed potatoes, broccoli cauliflower cheese bake, the butcher block and any of the desserts! You can watch the pasties being made daily! The variety of choices on fillings is overwhelming in the best way possible! The staff is knowledgeable and quick to recommend based on taste preferences!

h_H16qzl6LrYiDhYeD8hhA.text: Food like no other place! Wonderful food, great drinks, and even better dessert.  A True gem!    My family and friends feel welcome and whether empty or packed the service is on point!

47Qdmh6RDPPBqPAf39w0Rg.text: Came here with a friend for lunch. Although it seemed a bit busy we were allowed to chose our own seating. 71F in Phoenix, you bet were sittings outside on their cool little patio. I ordered the Reuben. Nice and fluffy crust with all the fittings you'd expect in a Reuben. I loved my food. My friend complained that it was too hot and burned his mouth a couple of times  The real bummer moment for me was when I finished my food. I found a rather large piece of hair underneath my pastry. I let my waitress know and man was she embarrassed (it wasn't her hair). They were cool enough to take care of me and apologized many times. I get it, shit happens. But it's always the cool ones who actually do something about it and not just shrug to shit happening. I'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet views from the patio

iac-xg2NP8Tl6Ey8chnQtg.text: Sarah was an awesome bartender and knowledgeable server. Customized our drinks perfectly.  The best!!

djxVuG1g7ieXCzdtntxfyA.text: The atmosphere was so fun! We ordered two Old Fashioned's and they were so yummy. We really enjoyed the space and the service was wonderful.

23iIeWtbozK-eqrRd-lZkQ.text: The worst service i ever got. Left bed Fore our food even made an entrance. I will. Ever come back here again

QUje6nNXp7rpzzGAhPcjCg.text: This place is nice and dark, perfect for a date night. Dinner and pool upstairs and drinks downstairs in the lounge area makes this a perfect night on the town!

sd-q20JNEqFzjOUfkgtCTw.text: We can, and often do, eat here multiple times in the same week! Our food is always amazing! Over the weekend I took my MIL and SIL here before we caught a matinee at the Orpheum. They had never been to any of the locations so I was excited to have them experience a favorite of mine. We went after they had a busy Friday/Saturday so the menu was more limited but everyone still found something that was appealing and our lunch was excellent. Tonight though we went after happy hour with friends and since I had just been I wanted to do a different pasty than my typical rotation. I had been avoiding the cottage pie because it seemed to simple compared to the rest of the adventurous menu choices but I went for it- it was literally one of the best things I've ever eaten! I love cottage pie typically, but in pasty form it's to die for! I cleared my plate, which rarely happens because portions are so generous. No wait for a table, our waitress was attentive, and our food came out quick. You really can't go wrong with Cornish Pasty!

QMbtZFsfkp_PVcS40exXXg.text: Great service! Food was excellent! Ordered the "Bangers and Mash" and the "Thanksgiving" pasty. Both were delicious! The pasty itself was not heavy at all, but close to a pound, so it was filling. The sausage used for the "Bangers and Mash'' was full of flavor and very lean. Everything was very good! Will definitely be back!

hnh5P1UScSnzP8yPQF6gYw.text: Cornish pasty is so bomb. When I'm in Phoenix, we usually end up here at some point throughout the night for pasties and drinks. I've tried like 3 or 4 different ones and have not been disappointed yet. There are three floors in this bar, which is crazy to me living in the bay. But it's really cool and guarantees you can get a drink quickly and strongly at any of the three floors. Downstairs is my favorite, if I'm being honest- it's probably the best floor to end your night at. Upstairs is for the start of the night, before getting TOO lit. I'm going back to phoenix in about a month and I'm drooling right now as I type this thinking about the Philly cheesesteak pasty I'm ordering as soon as we hit Cornish Pasty

LKBOl8lgSneTiaJP5mFsmA.text: Love this spot...downstairs is a small, intimate dining area with a bar and large, comfy booths. Romantic if you want it to be. The main floor has wooden booths...not as comfortable as the ones downstairs tho. Pool tables upstairs!  The food...we mostly eat vegetarian pasties...the Cuban is my new favorite other than the ever-delicious Tikka Masala. Lovely bit of salmon is tasty too.  Ask for the vegan pasty of the day...the vegetable vindaloo is one is great. Cider on tap. You can't go wrong here. They even have gluten free items...you can bring your paleo friends and make them jealous by eating a pasty right in front of them. ;P

XVonRHE3hj1J0kv02F3upA.text: Finally! Downtown Phoenix gets to experience the wonderful Cornish Pasty's that the world has been indulging in for hundreds of years. The downtown quarter has needed this unique restaurant and drinking establishment for many years.   In one weeks time it was packed, service was great and the owner was constantly working to make great customer experiences and train his staff.   I appreciated their soft launch menu to ensure they could handle the volume and make all the hungry guests happy.   The food was so good we ordered a third to split and we're so full we forced ourselves to walk away from dessert.   Highly recommend this entire experience.

Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

59bnbspSbO6Vk3vUEIosLg.text: Wonderful array of pasties, including vegetarian options. I bought a small sampling of different pasties, including traditional sausage rolls, beef and mushroom, and the vegetarian option, spinach and feta. We reheated everything for dinner several hours later, but nothing suffered the delay. The pastry was crisp and not too greasy; pasties were light but packed with well-seasoned filling.   Additionally, there's a well-stocked British goods section--Branston pickle, Heinz beans, Robinson's squash, and just about every kind of candy bar you would want. As I was checking out, I noticed a bowl of Scottish butter tablets, and grabbed a few for ol' memories' sake! I can buy much of this at Wegmans, and even have standing Amazon orders for PG Tips and Heinz beans, but seeing everything together with the pasties was a bit like being in England again!  I had read the rave reviews in WaPo, but never took the time and opportunity to go because it's so out of my way, but for a quick fix for authentic British fare, we will be back!

_lqb7u8kczfRwEC9Q83yhg.text: Just went in and was told to find a table as it is open seating. Sat down and waited about 5-7 minutes for a waitress to come. She did come and told us she was taking our table for a big reservation that they just took. No sorry or anything appropriate just "Go look upstairs for another table."  Giving 1 star because couldn't choose less. Worst customer service I have ever encountered.

r4wvYN-fpErZRgxgYwXK1g.text: I came here for lunch during the week. Parking can be a challenge, but if you plan ahead you wont be completely annoyed by it. We sat downstairs in what once was Monroe's bar. I had the cajun chicken pasty and broccoli cheese side and chips. My pasty was really good, I didn't really like the ham in it, but it was still good. I tried to have it excluded but since the pasty takes time to make, they are not able to modify what is listed on the menu. We had great service and loved the dark speakeasy feel of the downstairs of the restaurant. I will definitely be back for more. Oh and the most important part, they have coke products!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kWL_QjfPoUxD0_pHt5fW2A.text: I liked this place in Vegas, and I think it is based here in Phoenix, but this was a really terrible experience.  First of all, it is a Monday night and not that busy. I sat at the bar upstairs.  Brownie points for having purse hooks under the bar!  The bartender was very distracted and the only person behind the bar besides someone washing glasses.  She seemed annoyed since I only ordered water.  I tried to flag her down forever to order a pasty.  It took a really long time to get her attention.  Once she came over, she said the restaurant was out of my first three choices.  I heard her go through this with everyone around me - out of most pasties, salads, appetizers...it was pretty ridiculous.  I settled on lamb and mint.  It took a long while to come out, and of course it came without silverware or napkins.  The food runner found some for me eventually.    The pasty was burnt, and the lamb was dry, a bit fatty, and hard to chew.  When I finished, the server came by and I asked to close out since she took my card to start a tab.  She immediately got distracted and returned to making drinks.  I tried to flag her down until she finally brought my bill.  I just wanted to get the heck out of here.  I do not recommend coming - if a Monday night has no food or service, it must be worse as it nears the weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb and mint

_KPjRQG3QebpJwKCs9csEA.text: Get the cajun chicken Pasty!  Omg so good with the ham, cheese and chicken! All thier pasties are hand made and are sooooo bomb! We sat belly up at the bar and saw employees making them. Each were handled with love, care and loaded with ingredients. Once ordered we had to wait a good 30 mins for it to come out but it was super fresh out of the oven. The top of the pasty was crisp and the bottom was perfectly gooey.   The inside, omg. Everything just complimented each other. CAJUN CHICKEN PATSY!

sQbJlUqALRvw6TZdU7Wivg.text: I love literally everything about this place, full stop.   Yelp wants me to write more, so here's some unrelated poetry:  Had I the heaven's embroidered cloths, Enwrought with golden and silver light, The blue and the dim and the dark cloths  Of night and light and the half-light; I would spread the cloths under your feet: But I, being poor, have only my dreams; I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.  W. B. Yeats  Now shut up and go eat some 11/10 pastys.

i6NpCXYLIjPNanKLpPWm8w.text: Terrible service. Terrible timing. Got chased out by a dumb lazy bartender over a salad that never came to my party. Absolutely sad to see such an old sleezy bartender threaten me with violenc over $6 for a salad that never came to us. Grow up for your own sake ya big overgrown child. Find me if you still have a problem you sorry waste of life. Disappointed overall in every aspect.

y72PdNVTkM6-iLgukaMF9A.text: Great place with great atmosphere. If you are looking for a unique place when visiting Phoenix this is it. They have three levels to pick from when visiting if you just looking for a drink they have a large selection but I do recommend eating here. The pastys are awesome and so many unique choices. The staff are making them in the open so you can watch them being made while you dine or enjoy a drink
