gnSaqQbcV1GGnephw8_t_Q.text: The food has never let me down but the service needs improvement. Please don't ignore my table and then give me attitude when I go to the bar to get a glass of water. I also don't need you to complain about how you're working solo and trying not to cry. If I were you,  this would be the best time to make as much money as possible.   Outside of service, food is incredible!

cbGUcZ35nnYeaTnIJmVX2w.text: If you have never been to pasty (pay-stee) place, you haven't tried one of the best foods that our UK friends have to offer. A pasty is essentially a meat hand pie, but Cornish Pasty would challenge even that definition as they have vegetarian and even vegan pasties! Their selection here of pasties is simply incredible. They have some of the classic fillings you would find in a pasty and some new ones I have never seen before as they are very creative.   As this is pub the interior is pretty dim and the vibe is ulta-casual. My colleague and I had lunch here when we were attending a conference (bonus: short walking distance from the Phoenix Conference Center) and we sat upstairs at their bar area. The bartender was friendly and attentive and brought us drinks right away. My colleague tried a few of their beers here and seemed to enjoy them. I didn't have a beer but noticed they had a pretty good selection.   I settled on ordered the Guinness Stew pasty ($12.00) which has beef simmered in a Guinness gravy, with red potato, mushrooms, carrot, and celery. Layered with cheddar, sauteed leeks and cabbage. It is served with a side of sour cream with chives in it. I devoured this pasty then waddled back to the conference. I did not eat dinner that night because I was both still full and not wanting anything to eat that wasn't as good as a pasty.   I wish that where I live there is a pasty place but because there is not this place would be top of my list to come back to next time I'm in Phoenix! Great food, casual atmosphere and good service made for a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The menu
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Guinness pasty

RquHHOeHBw3pEsvnXuxOUw.text: That's right! 5 stars and from just one visit. It's that good! My co workers and I stopped in for lunch one afternoon. Cornish Pasty is directly next to our building, no reason why we didn't stop in sooner. We're all fans now!   Between the three of us we tried the tomato soup (delicious), the Italian, the Carne Adovada, and the Cubano. We all tried each other's food and enjoyed everything but the Italian and the tomato soup took the damn cake! The Italian is exactly what you would imagine, picture a warm Italian sub in a pastry kinda. Pepperoni, ham, salami, fresh basil, mozzarella and a side of warm marinara sauce. It's EXCELLENT!! Don't miss out on this gem!

mKJjGywcDqEORagoAsC3iw.text: Went to try some vegan pasties. They did not disappoint! Don't forget to try the peanut butter and jelly pasty for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pot pie pasty, Cuban pasty.

LcvyDT-0vR4_vjDlUUcNow.text: Wow! So many choices; so little time! Let me say I could never eat a whole pasty. I will definitely take half home. I had the pot roast tonight. It was hot, tasty and satisfying.

bx0wruQF9dsdiwk-nuJRSA.text: I'm not often inspired to write reviews when a place has hundreds already--why bother putting my awesome talents into something that will inevitably become lost amid the piles of paperwork? But I gotta give a quick shout-out to this obviously popular and well-loved pasty (no, not Patsy, nor pastey. That's pasty with a short "a") shop.   Seasoned goodies through whatever means nestled inside delectable hot bread is perhaps the one thing all 7billion of us can agree is a most exquisite invention, so I won't waste your time telling you how magnificent the dishes were. What I will say is the vegetarian options are out-o-freakin-sight! I don't remember a non exclusively-vegetarian or otherwise Asian food place I've been with so many. And beyond the sheer volume of options is the brilliant array and selection of meatless products. The Qorn brand chick'n they use is absolutely worthy of an omnivore's appetite, but they also had faux pork and beef and included a jackfruit based protein.  My second shout-out is to the cellar bartender. I don't recall her name; I want to say it was Brittany. But on a D-E-D Tuesday evening, she kept me company most wonderfully and offered the perfect balance of conversation and mind-your-own. Her suggestions were great and her charming personality just added delightfully to my experience of the place.   The place picked up around 8 or so, BTW. Pretty sure the locals love it here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fnHDt6omWvJXcvgMCkeQsA.text: We absolutely love this place. Had the opportunity to meet with the developers during the summer expressing the amount of time taken to make this place absolutely perfect per the owners request. Even pushing back the due date just to make sure it was perfect.   Location and decor are spot on for a pasty establishment. Meeting with the bartender downstairs, come to find out it use to be a speakeasy with a hidden staircase leading from the street level. Pretty cool.   Then there's the food. Today we brought the family, which is also great for kids as well as couples and friends. We started as always with their bread and butter... everyone loves it... I always opt for a Kronenbourg 1664 (yep on tap) and my wife grabbed one of their many delicious cocktails.   Their tomato soup is amazing and made fresh in-house... we shared many things such as the pasta salad, The Royale with Cheese, and the Cajun Chicken. All really hit the spot with plenty left overs for dinner.   Really enjoy the history behind the pasty as well.   I highly recommend this to anyone...

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tomato Soup... made fresh
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cajun Chicken!!
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Royal!!

WeanUWcHcju1cChq7BsGuw.text: Experienced this spot with friends and family. Boy did we have a good time. We were able to get a table for 8 in a timely manner of walking in. Plus after ordering our pastys darts opened up for 4 of us to play. Needless to say my team won and the losers were welcomed with shots of whiskey.   Great location. Fun hip atmosphere. And tasty food! I ordered the Vegetarian Balsamic Portobello Mushroom pasty and the flavors were insane. i thoroughly enjoyed the great textures of the pasty combined with the portobello and the savory balsamic.    Must try!

KJrIiU1LIpBYl-sP0D_iXw.text: I loved the lamb vindaloo pasty. My friend got the tikka masala pasty. Both had a good flavor, it tasted like an English style Indian curry, which is tasty, and it's also what they were aiming for, I think. This place is really cool! I went for lunch and the atmosphere is cool with a big bar to sit at wooden beam ceilings. I'll go again. The food was great!

Lhcik0mIOEQwRdYibNx2xg.text: I've now once been to this Pasty location once, and had it delivered to the house via Postmates once.   Having been to their Tempe location(s) on multiple occasions, I'm still working my way through the menu.      I love the vibe in the place, their eclectic music playlist, and of course the unique food and craft beer selection.   One my visit, we sat on the main level and service was great.     I've begun to try their vegetarian options and recently had the Veggie Cottage Pie with vegetarian "ground beef".  To be totally honest, I could not tell by taste or texture that the Quorn brand vegetarian ground beef wasn't the real thing.  It was delicious.    Last night, when we ordered pasty's for the family via Postmates, I had the good old fashioned Royale with Cheese...with real beef.  It did not disappoint.  Go with the 1000 island!    Kudos to both Cornish Pasty and Postmates because all four of our Pastys were at the perfect eating temperature when they were delivered.

JGw46Sa1xI2vYA7t84IvKA.text: Cornish is a fun and creative bar/restaurant in the heart of downtown. The decor is pretty gothic but trendy.  They have pews for tables (but not open during the day).  This is like a cross of Victorian England and a modern pub.  The pastys are, it is often said, like upgraded "hot pockets."  They have a ton of flavors.  The PILGRIM is by far my favorite and is a pocket of Thanksgiving warmy goodness.  So is the Cubano, you can never go wrong with a Cubano.  You can't substitute ingredients.  They are pre-made in house, closed, then baked. Pastys are the ultimate comfort food. Basically, take all your favorite things and then wrap them in a pastry and bake it. OKAY. You can't ask for much more.   Happy hour has great prices for mules and beer on tap!  Seriously give this place a try. Perfect for a cold, rainy day, or a late night bite. Or pretty much whenever you feel like eating a bunch of comfort food (so always).

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cubano
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pilgrim

bKRuv3jT4LSC_sknq4JwTA.text: I was in downtown Phoenix, it was mid-day and I was a little hungry. Noticing a sign for the Cornish Pasty Company, I decided to see what they had to offer. This rustic pub /restaurant had both upstairs and downstairs seating. Friendly wait staff and interesting and extensive menu. Lots of Pasty options.  I like beer and I am an avid coffee drinker .... so, it is no surprise that I needed to try the coffee infused beer. It was cool and refreshing on a hot day in Phoenix - surprisingly tasty. To compliment my beer, I ordered a pasty called the Pilgrim. I was delicious - small pie loaded with roasted turkey, grilled onions, stuffing and sweet potatoes. This came with a dipping sauce of red wine gravy and cranberries.   Good food, great atmosphere, helpful staff and competitively priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7TNInkCQBfUv0eJhAUmsEA.text: Okay so this old building is really neat, they have 3 floors and each is different. The basement is kinda an old speak easy there's even a hidden trap door above the side walk where people used to come in. The middle floor is the main floor where u can watch them make the pasty's which if you are really hungry will make you order the entire menu. The top floor is very comfy and casual and has pool tables and couches. This is a really fun and down to earth establishment.    Now the food is really good and filling I cannot eat a full pasty myself so I always have left overs. My favorites are the cubano, the Italian and the pilgrim. Don't forget to try the Scotch egg and the Cornish meatballs.  You have to save room for dessert the peanut butter and jelly pasty is really good and so is the banoffe pie.   I also love there cocktail menu their rum drinks are my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pilgrim pasty with red wine sauce and cranberry sauce.
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banofee pie, Cornish meatballs and the Italian.

U3SU_G6NwaCOabfUKhR_8w.text: Cornish Pasty was kind of a surreal experience, at least for me. It's an English pub theme somehow mixed with a hipster/punk bar. The ground floor has a bar but most will head upstairs to fine more seating, another bar, pool tables and darts.  The menu appears to be more of a list of things they "sometimes have" so be prepared with second, third or even fourth choices. They were about of 2/3 of the apps on our visit leaving only wings available. So we had soup, which was pretty good.   There were out of about 1/3 of the pasty choices as well. My coworker was sad to miss the chicken pot pie - her second choice (pork, apple, sage) was "ok" but she said she'd probably have something else next time. My first choice was unavailable as well so I had a tikka masala pasty ($13?). It was HUGE - definitely enough to fill a hungry person up, and had a crust that would make Paul Hollywood proud. The filling was "ok" - I appreciated that it was a little spicy.   Service was great - never had to wait for anything honestly. A bonus is a really nice wine list at fair prices.   Overall, I liked it and would definitely come back. Hopefully, they're not out of everything I want to try!

1y5qlI0Kx9SyJbNw81G46A.text: Cornish Pasty is one of my favorite restaurants in the Phoenix area for sure, though the downtown location is not my favorite. It's very often quite busy, so you usually end up waiting about an hour for your pasty if it's a weekend. Which is totally fine if you plan ahead, but very anxiety-inducing if you're like me and rushing to get to a concert and high strung to begin with. The service is usually decent but nothing to write home about; sometimes you gotta work fairly hard to flag down a server if it's hoppin' and they're all busy. It's a seat yourself situation, so they don't always notice when a new table comes along.   However, 10 out of 10 times, I would say that all of this is worth the food.  It is truly one of my favorite Phoenix restaurants and I always recommend that out of towners swing by. I've had probably half of the menu at this point, but my tried and True go-to is the rosemary chicken. Ugh so flaky and delicious and wonderful and perfect. Another tried and True is the guiness stew; and that one is probably a little more hearty and unique. Plus! My vegetarian friends love that you can get vegetarian/vegan options!  They always have a really solid beer selection, as well as a full bar, so it's a great place to grab a drink. Never been for happy hour, but it's on my list to check out soon!

5U9Wc6HfoaeJGKqx-_inuQ.text: I likely wouldn't go back. I was staying at a nearby hotel and decided to try this place. The service was extremely slow. When I tried to order they were out of my first four choices. When I finally got my food, I had to send it back because it was cold. I wanted to like this place and think the concept is great but the service and food was lacking. My issue with the food is that it didn't have much flavor. My original choices were some of their spicier options, maybe if they were available I'd feel different about the food. A couple of suggestions, maybe they should go to having a chalkboard type menu and just list the pasty's they have and have more than one server/bartender on the main level. She was working hard, just overwhelmed.

mIFuJn3Pzfeo62_j5inncQ.text: The food was creative and super delicious. Lots of variety and unique choices. Service was horrible. I would like to go again and try sitting on one of the lower levels to see if that makes a difference.

rRdsFw1Cq-TgTp9VeCEHbg.text: I like the atmosphere of the place. Three floors: pool table in top floor with bar but seams to never have a bar tender, middle floor bar area and kitchen, downstairs super dark room nice for dates. Food was okay had the meatballs but they tasted like dirty dish rag. Also had their  version of an empanada  it was good. Nothing that made me go yummy. But good beer selection. Will go back for beer. Beer me !

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bCxJXJIfzOveDY3pSlaxKw.text: Love this place! We came yesterday and sat downstairs ( no idea it was three stories) great service. Haley was such a great server and recommended delicious drinks. Even though we were the only ones down stairs she checked on us constantly and made sure we were enjoying everything. The chicken pot pie pasty is beyond words!!!! Will definitely come back!

XYjRj1SZUfk3sIxbpHT-ZQ.text: I enjoyed the atmosphere. The pastry I had was ok but better after being re-heated. I want to go back and try at least 3 other pastries.

fliNMKooGhVJ6jLFjtbOYg.text: I am so happy that Cornish Pasty has opened up downtown. I loved going to the original location in Tempe while I was at ASU and the new downtown location does not disappoint!  This new location is massive. They have an upstairs dining area, a ground floor section with church pew tables like the original Cornish Pasty, outdoor area, and a downstairs area with a lounge bar vibe.  I typically got the delicious vegetarian eggplant parmesan pasty, but I decided to try the Lovely Bit of Salmon and it was indeed lovely. The salmon was delicious and tasted amazing in a pasty filled with asparagus, tomatoes, spinach and potatoes. I also tried out the Apple Caramel Pasty with ice cream for dessert which was delicious.   I've read some other reviews about slow service and have to say that I experienced the opposite. While there, our waitress came up to apologize about the wait for our food (which really didn't seem abnormally long) and us offered the free dessert. How amazing is that?!?! Talk about amazing customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lovely Bit of Salmon (soo good!)
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple Caramel Pasty

noS9i9cQmyfhasmj8E1frQ.text: Just fire. Straight gas pastys. Would recommend this place to anybody looking for some flame pasty's and good service. Top shelf medicinal level pasty's.

hZvWjlFew5VZSG_LBo5a-Q.text: I really, really wanted to love this place. I love a great urban patio, and this has it.  The space is amazing; beautiful old building with indoor/outdoor bar/patio.  I secured a great table on the street for people watching on a magnificent Saturday afternoon.  While my husband parked, i got a Guinness.  I let the server know there would be 2 of us.   He arrived shortly after, and we commenced to wait and wait and wait.  As we scanned, we could see the server was doing the entire first floor including bar-tending and cashier.  We finally after about 15 - 20 minutes asked a kitchen staff to grab our waitress.   A few minutes later she was back and took his drink order.  She also let us know the kitchen was understaffed and our food would take 35 minutes.  OK.  We had a great table and nothing else to do so fine.  But we put in our order.  My husband is vegan and that drew us here as they had a huge selection for him.  But, she advised they had only 1 of the vegan pastys available.  So he ordered that. Later she returned to advise his first choice was available after all.  The food did finally arrive in about 30 minutes.  I ordered a meat and cheese pasty and it was amazing.  Golden brown crust, spiced sausage and wine dipping sauce.  I ate every bite.  My husbands, however, was  visibly under-cooked.  He ate the brown part and liked it but as he worked his way down it became less done until it was finally raw.  He just at that point ate the filling.  I get places being understaffed on occasion, but she expressed no remorse for the horrible service or food.  We also had to send back a cocktail that was wrong, and she said oh i know what i did wrong.  The fixed one was no better.  Never an apology.  I'd love to try again, but not sure i can get my husband back.   Very sad as I was sure this was going to be my new favorite place.  A beautiful space cannot make up for a bad experience.  It wasn't even that crowded.

MHOOcS6OoNpgdK59qaDzMQ.text: What a nice surprise to find one of these right next to our hotel in Phoenix!! We have been in Flagstaff and have been wanting to go back. This one seems to have more of a bar atmosphere than the one in Flagstaff, but of course it is Friday night. The music and the crowd were loud but we still managed a good conversation. We had a nice table by the window upstairs. Our primary server was nice and helpful, our secondary food server was full of attitude and rather gruff. The food was great! I had the chicken Greek and my wife had the roast. We shared the curried potatoes. We had the apple caramel pastie for dessert. The apples weren't done enough and all of the caramel and cinnamon were on one end. Overall the amount of food and taste were a good value for the money!

gvvY9U_zPC2mfM8AE880WQ.text: He service was excellent, the venue was super cute, dark, the pool table, Jenga, and darts were a nice touch with 3 different floors. The food was good I have to say it was different went with a large group and was able to try different ones the leek soup was excellent... but the best part was the deserts highly recommend bakoovie  banana pie was off the hook

W0ZvokDR2aakaGOi4Zlf0g.text: Co-workers and I came opening day not knowing what to expect. We were their 3rd official customers and within the first few bites we knew it was our new favorite lunch spot in downtown Phoenix! Very cool tri-level space with an English pub feel. We sat in a church pew-like table on the main floor and the place was getting pretty packed around lunchtime.  We started off with an order of Scotch Eggs (my 1st time) and it was super tasty.. wish there were more than four slices but flavors did not disappoint.  As for our main orders.. I ordered the Roast Beef Sarnie (like an English take of a Philly) and it was so delicious!  Amazing crust, the best ingredients, and they were huge! The others ordered The Pilgrim x2 (Thanksgiving pasty) and the Oggie (the original pasty). They were all yummy, but I loved mine the most!  Loved the food so much, we recommended it to 2 other folks at work who each ordered the Reuben Pasty and they both had rave reviews.  One of the co-workers even went back the next day; that's how good it was!  And I plan on taking the husband this weekend so he can try, too!  Food was amazing.. service was outstanding & food did not take long to be prep'd during the lunch crowd.. Also, reasonable pricing as most Pasties were between $10-$12.. Portion is huge enough to share, but you probably won't want to share, lol! The only downside is there isn't a location near me in NW Peoria, but hopefully in the near future :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu from opening day
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roast Beef Sarnie
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Pilgrim

qeEmiRJalMrIYiRqDI6mHw.text: I gave Cornish Pasty 1 star not because the food was bad but because the service was slow, the first 5 pasty's we ordered they were out of, they ran out of the sauce for my pasty, and our waitress spent all her time at one table forgetting about us. Skip this restaurant and go to the one in Tempe!

9sHJWbbiEvIVq-YuHaQ04g.text: Food wise ... AWESOME all the way. Bring in a big appetite as these are very filling. I was stuffed despite of coming for late lunch and with a big appetite. I have never tried pasty before so I can not vouch for how authentic it is however our server explained this dish very well ... a pastry and calzone had a baby. I loved the fresh baked pasties.  The one star is taken away only because we went here for late lunch and the first 3-4 items we asked for were all over. Good sign I guess however I wish the server let us know before hand. Instead each time we asked for something the server had to go in come back again and tell us to pick something else. I will definitely come back to try the chicken tikka and lamb mint.   Anyways ... so in this visit we tried the Shepherd's Pie Pasty & Salmon with asparagus & dill pasty both were good but I liked the salmon one better since it was juicy and unexpectedly good. I have never had salmon calzone or pastry so I thought this was very innovative.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shepherds pie
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy

sj-VcP8bZYY9BIHkx9L63g.text: Another great visit to Cornish Pasty. We prefer to sit on the lower level of this gorgeous three-story restaurant. We were served by a bar tender and started with the tandoori chicken wings, very tasty! We split the cheeseburger royale as our entree, which we both enjoyed other than picking out the mushrooms. My only complaint about Cornish is that you cannot customize because they make the pasties ahead of time and just bake them when ordered. We were offered a nice selection of adult beverages and enjoyed the dark and swanky atmosphere this level offers. A good value for the food and just a neat place to bring out of town guests or when looking for a great meal when in downtown Phoenix.

XKBsuoji93K3WoNPx3NdAA.text: So Sean, our night in shining armor behind the bar, he is such a friendly guy. He made the mediocre drinks stellar was prompt and a good conversationalist. He keeps it real

m95z-kf0QprnVJdBayI1Zw.text: I love this Place! Old world charm, the atmosphere is really cool on the street level & upstairs but if you want to know where the True hidden gem is?? Where is the coolest bar in Phoenix you say? Go to the basement bar at Cornish Pasty... it's just AWESOME! The ambiance...dark and dreamy with chill music and the sweetest bartender Amanda. Her recommendation of the "Lovely bit of Salmon" was perfect! My Lord, it was delicious! Do yourself a favor, check this place out for yourself and if you're lucky Amanda will make you a Pie smasher cocktail with the fanciest Ice cubes you have ever seen!

w9vv_BeZ4zDoK_vJtNvEvA.text: Been in town for 4 days and wish I would have eaten here first. Almost to best chicken pot pie I've ever had, shout out to my wife. All food is served wrapped in a delicious pastry type shell. Service was also great. I'm actually sorry I will have to leave before I am able to eat here again.

nDCpfmM-24FUONx7Vv6AKQ.text: Absolutely worst place during an event night. If you Cannot handle a crowd the shut your doors. Horrible service

kVrE3-UvDo2gCgcV_sP8zA.text: I live right next to this place. I have been obsessed with the food ever since they first opened downtown. The PASTY'S are out of this world. Butttttt the service is terrible, in all the time I lived in Phoenix I have never been to a place with such terrible service. Then they wonder why they don't get a tip. If it wasn't for the food and ambiance, I don't think people would come here for a favorite bartender or server.

8Q5521chWHaV48M6W_F56A.text: The sandwiches are pre-made so if you are allergic to something or don't like an ingredient inside the sandwich, it can't be "made without." Or at least that's what the waitress said. I went with a group of 6 and at a slow time however the food took 45 mins to come out.  On the upside, I ordered a Greek salad and I have to admit it was one of the best Greek Salads I've ever had, the dressing was amazing. The prices are decent for the amount of food you get.

ro05k_AfumshjDsuuMrNug.text: There is a lot of eating in these pasties.  It's super casual, sit where you want, easy-going staff.  There are several different choices whether you're a meat eater or not.  A tip from me to you, if you get chips (fries), ask for a side of HP sauce. It's a better than ketchup.  The location is near Walking Stick, makes for a great choice pre show to avoid the high costs of the food.    The 5th star isn't even for my experience- over heard the server admit a mistake, apologize, and comp the meal. This was without being asked. Great service!

cpWM8AUBSVwzHfTJ_1wElw.text: UPDATE!!  Service was much better and quick this time around!  Thanks for checking in Aaron!  I'll be back as always!!  First off, I love this place.  I go to multiple locations probably once a week.  BUT, this particular location REALLY needs some help.  I feel they are about 4 crew members down all the time.  Food is always great, but SLOW SLOW SLOW.  Don't sit at the bar, no bar back and service really suffers because of it, because they are constantly washing dishes to keep up.   As I type this I have waited at least 30 minutes for my favorite desert.   My server is busting his ass running all around, but you cannot have one person having the entire top area, at least that is what appears to be happening.  Again, love the place, BUT, staff UP!  Please!!!  It's getting old and people are constrained downtown for lunch times.  Bottom line is not worth a bad / slow reputation, especially downtown

0zZU6xNOOL9Y7Wj02I_p8A.text: A weave experience here but I will be returning.  The ambiance is nice, but the upstairs can get a little loud with people enjoying drinks and billiards. Next time I will try the lounge since it was just me dining and I didn't need all the extra noise around me.  I tried the mushroom, walnut, spinach soup. It was delicious, very hearty and nutty. I don't like mushrooms at all but thought I'd give it a whirl. I ate almost all, and the bread it came with was nice, soft and dense. Like a good sourdough (but not sourdough). I could have had this as my meal alone and been happy.  The pasty's, they have soo many! It made choosing very hard. I decided to try bangers and mash, because I usually love the dish. It was cooked nicely and def a very generous portion size (esp with the soup) but there was some kind of spice they used in it that I did not care for. I have no idea what it was but it was too seasoned for a normal bangers and mash (which is pretty meat and potatoes style dish). The sauce it came with too didn't go with the flow of the pasty and would be better with a mustard I feel.   I am hoping with another visit and a different pasty (thanksgiving, Rueben and chicken pot pie are a couple I'm looking at) I'm hoping to be able to have a good experience. I love a good pasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom, walnut and spinach soup
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bangers and mash pasty. Sauce was weirdly paired and not needed.

yTBpd9kPB83vpzPqWGfuwQ.text: Would be everyone's favorite but as per me food is not as 5-star rating:  Ambience- 5/5  Location- 5/5  Servers - 5/5 Cleanliness - 2/5 (Just go to lounge to experience this) Tables were sticky and you would not feel to rest your arm even.  Food - 3/5  Price- 3/5   Soups are best here. I took mushroom walmart spinach one it was very good. Although bread provided with soup is hard and didn't felt like fresh.   Happy hour are senseless here. No discount on food and $1 off on drinks.   Coming to the British pasty for which it's famous. They crispy and taste good depending on your selection but presentation is below average. Served with just any sauce. They should definitely supplement pasty with some in house gravy. I ordered one (pastrami one) and server told they are sold out, so i had to select another and again she returned after 10 mins that they are sold out with that too.  I had to order #3 pesto chicken one and it tasted good. Other 2 friends and my wife ordered another 3 varieties and I would say mine was best tasting. 1 of the 4 was chicken tikka pasty and it was literally indian tikka curry inside pasty. So heavy and senseless expectations for any twist. Chicken pot pie was good but nothing special.  Average 11-13$ for just a pasty is not pricing they should offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom walnut spinach soup
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kvw9GC7qKH2gj6q72sruyg.text: This is one of our favorite places to go when we come downtown. To start, make sure you go downstairs to the bar area.  It has nice seating and can be a little quieter on a busy evening.  Upstairs is where the younger crowd seems to hangout and it can be loud, but good to meet people!  We have yet to have a pasty we didn't enjoy.  Today we had the spicy chicken Asiago and Greek chicken.  Both were incredible and True to their taste.  Our favorite though has to be the pot pie!! The way the pasty is expertly cooked to crispy perfection matches the amazing combination of ingredients inside.  If you have never been here, don't pass it by again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Greek Chicken
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Asiago Chicken

wsGizMEsXhVCfUC8zVpTcg.text: Simply awesome! I'm talking about the location, the ambiance  the service, and off course... The pasties!!! Delicious, fresh, and flavorful. They were hot. And filled with goey goodness. My friend had never been there and she loved it, so that means a lot. Our server was fast, kind, smiley. I really cannot say enough about this place. It smells delicious. Just like curry when you come in. The guys are simply cool. They let you seat wherever. You know they are made tho order because they make them right in front of you pretty much on their beautiful firs floor kitchen. Talking about floors, we sat on the second level. There a certain charm about this place. I couldn't get enough pics. I'm a happy camper for sure! And this is one more place I recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XL6ljVVpJ9hAivey1kD7kg.text: Their pilgrims turkey dinner pasty with cranberry sauce is Thanksgiving wrapped in a pasty.  Sooooo gooood, I'm salivating just thinking about it.   Super convenient and open late. Great place to grab a bite with a brew. Awesome for hangover food the next day. If you want to take some pasty's with you, for the loved ones, you can ask for the frozen ones to take home. I would transport a few pasty's from Arizona all the way to Hawaii, sometimes.

zT8YLc5Vz_tGi8WjN-nTjQ.text: Interesting...  The few things I really liked about this restaurant was the pool table  and the darts .   My experience here was a 1 star. My food was very hard to eat and I did not get what I expected. The waitress waiting us could have been much gentler and kinder.  But, the rest of the members of my party enjoyed (their meal actually had meat and the normal amount of cheese!!) their dining here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Billiards
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Darts
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My food... Lots of cheese, no meat

3yCGVxBaEh7KPpRSd7T0VA.text: I love the atmosphere of this Cornish Pasty! Don't love the fact that you have to find parking (and pay for it), though. It's interesting that this Cornish Pasty has such a different vibe from the one in Scottsdale. Both have their own merits.  Of course, I had to order the same thing that I've had several times: The Pilgrim (just liking that Thanksgiving feeling with the cranberries, yum). However, this time my Pilgrim had way too much dark meat. It's a sign: time to try something else the next time I'm in! Actually, I'm rather thankful that the Pilgrim just didn't do it for me this time since the menu has been screaming at me to try something else. There are so many good things on the menu! I can hardly wait to go back now that I'm liberated from the Pilgrim.   Guinness on draft ... not as perfect as being in Dublin and having a Guinness on draft, but it'll have to do.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pilgrim
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xMVi-tUAW7HgATn48AO4Uw.text: Cornish Pasty is my go-to for lunch or dinner when I need that familiar and relaxing space. Downtown is a bit more busy than some of the other locations but like the Tempe location, there are several spaces within the building to install yourself, depending on your mood. Personally, upstairs is my favorite for solo dining and drinking but the street patio bar is great for friends. You'll find an extensive tap list of craft brews with something for everyone. And, when it comes to pasties, eat your heart out on the variety. Hipster staff with a good patron mix and excellent vibes abound here.  Oh!  And Jimmy just told me the stage is complete and they'll bring live music in soon. Can't wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quick beer and bite before hitting downtown

W-sf4bSUq2aRP_gp9SKlcg.text: I feel like I was maybe a little overly harsh on this place at first. After being dragged back, I realized I simply ordered the wrong things. Just don't go vegetarian/vegan. Sorry, animal-loving friends- I want to be on your side but this isn't the place for it. The Italian is my go-to for a flavorful savory pasty.  Drinks wise, the half off everything happy hour is great. The "where's Valley Bar?" is my drink here. For fans of fruity, sweeter stuff, it's the best thing on the menu. I still think the Tempe location has better signature cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Where&#39;s Valley Bar?

xcMCDj-OQtxE1XbMOdsIKQ.text: This is one of the small collection of Cornish pasty establishments that allows you to savor the delights of this English dish while enjoying a pint of Boddingtons or a draft Guinness.  If you are craving a Cornish pasty and you are not fortunate enough to be surrounded by English pubs, the Cornish Pasty Company has transplanted merrie olde Englande to the Phoenix area.   The atmosphere almost replicates those darkly cavernous pubs found in the West Country of England. Although a pint of scrumpy is not on the menu, all manner of fillings are available for your gastronomic enjoyment.   If you are a purist, then the only pasty you are going to choose is the original-the Oggie. And it really is! Once you have ordered this numerous times, you may be tempted to try one of the other delicious flavors.  This is the place for downtown chow, but you'll also get what you want at any of the Cornish Pasty Co eateries. Try this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Boddington&#39;s Ale

gfy3iZs3EzJbGalABZqjZg.text: I get it. This place is supposed to be hip. Literally, it's a hipster haven. I have nothing against hipsters, but I can't just give the Cornish Pasty 5-stars because to do otherwise is uncool. The truth is, there are a few things they could improve upon.  First, let's start with the good. The atmosphere/vibe of the place is different/neat. I like the dim lighting. Not everyone in my party loved it, but I don't mind (aside from it being difficult to read the menu). I dig the three stories and how every floor has a different vibe. The music was good; heavy on the Allah-Las, whom I happen to love. The English pub theme is actually really awesome. Oh and everyone seemingly enjoyed all of their pasties.  So what's not to like?  Well, the servers were okay, but we had about three different ones. With that, there seemed to be some miscommunication. My wife's pasty didn't make it out until the rest of our group had finished ours.  No one seemed to come around to refill our drinks, so I had to run to the bartender across the restaurant to do that. The same deal with napkins and straws. Lastly, we ordered wings specifically with no sauce for the kids and they came out smothered in sauce, so the kids had to wait awhile to eat as well.   Even though they held it back, I got the sense that the servers were slightly annoyed by our special requests (the naked wings & no ice in the drinks for my European in-laws). With all of this taken into consideration, it took what could've been a great experience and turned it into a pretty average one.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Tt4lCl7sivP2XYhP6czwjA.text: I love Cornish and have had great experiences at other locations across the valley. Both times I have been to this location it's the same great food but not great service.   I was there on a Monday night in the downstairs portion and our server was extremely uninterested in waiting on us. Granted we were there late, but he was seemingly upset with us when we told him we we there for food not drinks. Also waited a long time for water refills and never got more than one.   It took us a far too long to get our order in, our food, and our bill. We were there much longer than we needed to be and ended up bailing on dessert since we didn't want to wait another 30 mins for that.   I may come back again but definitely opt for other locations around the valley

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rueben with thousand island - yum!

QpH4PQ978gl4wHruZER3-g.text: What a surprise! I did not expect the variety and taste of the food that I experienced at the Cornish Pasty. The name threw me off too. If you are vegetarian or vegan you'll like this place. Instead of just a few items to satisfy those who preference is that there are ample amount of items among the menu that cater to vegetarians or vegans to choose from. Highly recommended even if you are not vegan or vegetarian. Try it you'll like it. You won't be disappointed.

bhm--COH5K7dw8LGd2EISg.text: This place was absolutely amazing. The staff was extremely friendly as soon as we stepped into the door. Which, while on the way in, they had a nice little patio area with mist sprayers to keep you cool. It's a bit darkish on the inside, but it really creates a nice atmosphere where people can sit and enjoy each other's company. Even during a busy evening the service did not lack, and seeing so many delicious entrees passing by made the wait so much more worth it. When I say EVERYTHING that came out of the kitchen looked good I mean it. I saw a banoffee pie sneak out that made me regret not saving room for dessert. I was in a party of 3 so we tried each other's meals (2 pasty's, 1 Cobb salad, some fries, and cheesy broccoli bake). There were no bites that were less than tastefully orgasmic. I apologize for the use of the word, but the explosions of flavors in my mouth were legendary. Even my friend (from the UK) highly enjoyed it. I was more upset that my stomach couldn't hold more than it can. You will not go wrong with this choice. Also, everything was very affordable and the restaurant was kept nice and cool. Loved it here!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guinness stew pasty!
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dWT9LyqdZIcLrHjk8IqJjQ.text: A buddy of mine is going through the big D (and I don't mean Dallas-as the song goes).  He's relocated to the hip section of downtown Phoenix and restaurant scene has some great options.  And for an authentic Montana raised (wannabe) cowboy like myself, pasty's (a Butte, America standard) are always a welcome addition to any menu, let alone one with two dozen options!  We sat outside on a beautiful fall Phoenix day, the restaurant faces north so there was plenty of shade to be had.  Service was fantastic from a cheerful, tattooed, redhead (The P is a ginger so I'm partial).   T got the Turkey dinner pasty and I went with the Cubano.  He enjoyed his but I think my Cubano was the better of the two.  The pasty's are made right in front of the bar and popped into the oven for finishing.  This is not McDonalds, it takes a few minutes to properly bake a pasty and it's worth it.  Nice hot, flaky crust and a cold beverage on a perfect day.  Did I say I was riding right before lunch?  It just doesn't get a whole lot better.  I'm looking forward to coming back for dinner and enjoying the old bar inside, great vibe, no charge pool and darts, and a second floor looking out over downtown Phoenix.  I almost felt like I was shuttled back to the mining days of Butte, MT.  Great place!

jLurjf14SxqSi1cUjgaugw.text: This huge bar is three levels in a turn-of-the-century building. I like the vibe and the spaciousness, but the food leaves something to be desired.  On the plus side, they have vegan Cornish pasties.  I got the vegan "vinny" vindaloo pasty ($13) but didn't like it. It was too starchy and had a one-note flavor of excessive spice.   If Cornish Pasty offered a seitan and potato gravy pasty, maybe with green onions, I'd be back. As it stands, come here for a drink and to hang out with friends but don't bother with the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior of vegan vinny vindaloo pasty ($13). Meh. Starchy and one - note spicy with limited textures. Think low-quality samosa.
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan &#34;vinny&#34; vindaloo pasty ($13). Meh. Really starchy and one-note spicy. Lack of texture.

fp8vAfbNH7Ebf1bXta080A.text: Sit upstairs against the window and you get a great spot for people watching. We've gotten a couple pints and split a pilgrim pasty during Phoenix Fan Fusion, just to watch all the amazing, fun, and funny costumed characters walking by. Perfect spot to watch the people on Central with or without costumes, however.   If you're not into people watching, head to the upstairs bar where you can play pool in the dark ambiance. Or get a group together and get rowdy downstairs.   Great location, chill servers, filling food.

P4oC0w0QiX-1AAuOlGRWvQ.text: Great atmosphere and drinks.  There are wonderful vegan options always  here and they usually switch it up and they're all yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good vegan options every day.  This is the vegan cubano

YUOpZe739C2TGVO337I96w.text: Love this place I was thrilled when I flipped over the menu and found vegetarian and Vegan Pasties! Super delicious flavor for vegan I tried the vindaloo...yum if you are vegetarian the tikka masala is where it is at. My mom had the rosemary Pastie I had a bite and was super in love. The server was super attentive to filling up out waters even though we were just getting take out! Will be back soon on my next cheat night!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0EB1GLmRgtcnNis1je9cPQ.text: I'd never been to a Cornish Pasty. But visited this one during a business trip in Phoenix. Loved it!  Food was great, not too expensive and the location was unique.  I had plenty of leftovers- great value for what the dinner costs. Definitely recommend!

Yv92ipeNm6OEqGHjxPhT8w.text: Hands down my favorite restaurant in Phoenix- regardless of the location. Each location has its own spirit and draw, but no matter which one you go to you're going to get amazing squishy soft bread with your soup, and a crispy buttery pasty of one of dozens of varieties. In the many years I've been going to CP, my favorites have shifted from the tikka masala to the lamb vindaloo to the eggplant parm; the fillings are super creative! Come to the new downtown location for some free pool upstairs. Oh! And don't forget dessert. I'm not a fan of banana but if you ask they will sub strawberry on the banoffi pie (Strawnoffi anyone?). Amazing. I go out of my way to make CP a part of my plans when I drive up from Tucson.

_9sYTyYDplYw3m3t_7EHJQ.text: Unbelievably Tasty  My friends and I went to the Cornish Pasty Company for a bite to eat, and  all I can say is; the food was unbelievably tasty. Everyone cleaned their plates and wished there was  more.  Each person in our party ordered a different flavor, and each bite  was better than the next.  Lets face it, what's not to like?  Take flavorful meat, cheese, unique vegetable combinations, wrap it up in a flakey pastry, then bake it until hot inside and crispy outside.  Serve it up with a side dipping sauce, it doesn't get much better. While your waiting  for your delicious entree, take advantage of the great beer selection the Cornish Pasty Company has to offer.  Sip on a ice cold draft from a great selection while your delicious entree is baking.    The Cornish Pasty Company has a great atmosphere, very casual and comfortable.  Wish my phone wqs working because I would have taken pictures. I would  definitely go back to the Cornish Pasty Company again and again.

wEMi9x1YEcq9wXa7ClZgZA.text: Wow, just wow. This spot makes me question all the negativity I've heard over the years towards British food; it's all BS folks. This spot is great. I ordered the original oggie, an iron maiden beer, and toffee bread pudding for dessert. The steak in the oggie was seasoned with the right amount of pepper and complimented the gravy and flaky crust perfectly. Not a huge beer drinker but this was pleasant: malty with hints of citrus. I friggin' loved the dessert; not too sweet and delicious with the vanilla ice cream.   The atmosphere varies based on where you sit or what you're in the mood for, e.g. downstairs = romantic date?, upstairs = play time with billiards &/or darts, and plenty of bar seating. You gotta check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Toffee bread pudding
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iron Maiden trooper ale....In my opinion, it wasn&#39;t too bitter.

i0mGrDzM6zH8kMOUCisorQ.text: Obsessed! This is our go-to when we are out late bar hopping and want a pasty. Plus they serve food until 2a.m.!

fIbGKtxppPVzoyLuohNWVw.text: I've been wanting to check Cornish out for a while now and I was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere right off the bat-not overly pretentious, good balance of mood & energy in the place. Went in about 9 on a Friday night & sat at the bar. The staff at the bar were all friendly, not just the miss that was serving us. I had the sloe gin cherry fizz, which was very refreshing & perfectly sweet. Fiance & I shared the cottage pie & Cajun chicken pasties. Both were delicious! The gravy was intense, a little goes a long way. Can't wait to come back here & make it more of a habit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

P9LU5eTEwWBML86YZNVBNw.text: We stopped in to check out this interesting restaurant late last night on our way back from dinner. We wanted to take a look at their menu and get a good draft beer to take the heat off of the sweltering evening.   The pasty options are amazing - taking up an entire page of the large menu. We sat at the bar and watched them making a batch of 12 pasties. Their chef carefully constructed each pasty and cleaned the tables so meticulously. It was fun to watch!   We have a British restaurant in our home town and we were so excited to see mushy peas on the menu! We ordered some even though we already ate dinner a few hours before. They were cooked in a little cast iron pot and tasted delicious.   The bartender was super friendly and efficient. Beer selection is solid. Hoping to get back to try a pasty before we leave town.

JQGj2hEa27bB_CGWWFAFNw.text: What a gem! It's so deceiving from the street, I had no idea that it had a lower level and upper level with billiards and darts. I was able to sample a few different pasties: the pilgrim, the Cuban, and Guinness stew. All so very good but my go-to would be the Cuban. The tap list is also good and features some local to AZ as well as from MI (yay!) It's one of a few places open late in downtown PHX and definitely my fave.

1oIdxxBdMAF9YqgEDwAVkQ.text: Went late night yesterday. Place was crowded but the service was top notch. Banger and mash, chicken tikka masala pasties were amazing. Drinks came out fast and were good. Love this place!

SRO6AIh83ApqYU4INmYqsg.text: There are few restaurants I can remember in the valley that had more buildup, more anticipation, more frustration, and more confusion than when Dean Thomas decided to open his fourth valley Cornish Pasty location in Downtown Phoenix.  What started out as universal excitement soon turned into a years long nightmare for Thomas and a long confusing wait for Downtown patrons.  Dean was determined to make his Downtown Phoenix location the biggest and best in the chain and bought out a huge three story space on Central & Monroe back in 2010 to prove it.  But the more they renovated, the more problems they encountered (including having to rebuild all the building utilities from scratch).  Thomas was constantly forced to move back opening date due to all the calamities (and the escalating costs).  Seven years after Dean got the keys to the space, Cornish Pasty finally opened in Spring 2017.  Having been to Dean's restaurants in Tempe and Scottsdale, I was joyous.  For today's Saturday lunch, it was time to give the new place a spin.  Located directly across the street from Seamus McCaffrey's, Cornish Pasty's newest location evokes many of the familiar vibes you've probably encountered at their other locations, but with a larger and arguably more energetic vibe.  The basement floor in particular reminded me of Pasty's Tempe location with its darkly lit room, dark trimmed booths, and wooden accents.  The top floor is also somewhat dimly lit with wooden furniture all around, but with almost a sports bar feel with pool tables and its own separate bar.  And then of course there's the ground level, reminding me a lot of their Scottsdale location with patio seating out front and bar area seating that looks out over the kitchen.  At max capacity I'd guess the new Pasty can seat between 150-200 people.  A couple friends and I were able to get seating upstairs right away during today, but it was still an almost full house.  There are three main reasons why all the Pasty locations get 4.5 stars on Yelp.  For one, Pasty has an abundant beer selection on tap (typically a couple dozen) and there are usually multiple bar areas so as to serve patrons quickly (the Downtown location has three separate tap stations).  Another reason?  The pasties of course.  A wide array of foods stuffed into a pastry dough then cooked until the dough is hot and flaky and the ingredients inside are warm and stick to your ribs.  The third reason Pasty is so popular?  The prices.  The original location in Tempe opened with the idea of gaining traction with the legions of poor starving ASU students, and today you can still get a full sized pasty and a beer for $20 or less.  As this was my first meal at the new location, I decided to do a throwback to my first visit at the Tempe location.  I ordered the same thing I ordered all those years ago in Tempe.  A glass of Hoegaarden White Ale and a whole Chicken Pot Pie Pasty.  Total cost including tax and tip came to about $22.  The pasties may not look like a lot of food when you first order them, but there's pretty much no way you'll leave hungry if you have a whole one.  In fact most people I've dined with are good after a half pasty.  Me?  Well I couldn't help myself to all the chicken, carrots, green beans, red potatoes, celery, rosemary, and onion.  Oh and of course the gravy that comes on the side.  Hearty, old school, and pure.  I would say my favorite pasty of theirs to date has been their Carne Adovada, but I'm also a fan of about a half dozen other ones too (including a few of their dessert pasties).  In any event, you get the picture.  Good hearty food and beer for a reasonable price in a space that has many personalities.   The Downtown location fits perfectly into the neighborhood, offering a lengthy menu of delicious pasty concoctions sure to appeal to just about anyone.  Happy hour and late night will no doubt be epic here with a mix of Downtown college students, Downtown workers, and Downtown visitors likely filling up all three floors.  It was a cartoonishly long wait for the doors to open.  But Dean and his staff have made certain Pasty's newest location lived up to his dream, making the wait completely worth it.

3e1ufDZMdW0y_LdfWR1gsw.text: Went to the downtown location before my flight out and it was exceptional. I only had an hour but because I knew what I wanted, I had more than enough time. You cannot go wrong with the peppered steak. Let me say that again. You cannot go wrong with the peppered steak. Do yourself a favor and order one right now!  I have eaten at three of the locations around the PHX area and I can say that this one has the best ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OEzqKMFnEcm4ayxb_23hLg.text: We made the trip up to Phoenix as soon as CP opened because we were dying to check it out.  It definitely did not disappoint, the space is amazing and every level is different and well done. The second story was full when we got there but we were still able to find a table against the wall for three.  Everyone was BUSY but our server promptly brought menus and waters and beers soon after.  Their beer list is pretty impressive, nicely varied.  But we couldn't wait to get our hands on the food as we'd practically starved ourselves all day in anticipation of this visit.  We ordered the Cornish Meatballs and Garlic Mashed Potatoes with Cheese to start.  The meatballs are wrapped in bacon and covered in sauteed onions then served in a white wine mustard gravy  - every bit as delicious as it sounds.  For the Pasties I had the Chicken Pot Pie for the first time, I've tried a few others and this one is right up there on my list of favorites.  Basically a pot pie filled pasty with a side of rosemary gravy, awesome!  We all had a great time and enjoyed the delicious food and cold beers.  I have been back since and will continue to stuff my face at this location, it is the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mashed pots and meatballs
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious chicken pot pie pasty
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great beers and cocktails!

wCsro09ZDA-GPu7UDzZBDw.text: The atmosphere is terrific. Three levels to choose from. We chose to eat in the basement, which has a real speak-easy feel to it. It is dark and easy to talk to your tablemates.   There is a bar in the basement so it is easy to get your drink on. And the foot was terrific. I had never been to a Cornish Pasty location, so I tried their Oggi, which is their basic pasty. It was so well done. The crust was just thick enough, the meat and veggies were tender and juicy, and the red wine gravy...wow. You could drink that stuff, it is so good.  Portions are huge. I had to take home half. If you do that, be sure to reheat your food in the oven. It is worth the extra time so it comes out heated through and with a crispy outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

L8Dr4zfcOAnORMyjPBs4Kw.text: I have been to several of their locations and have not been disappointed. I have also tried varies patsy's and have enjoyed every one of them. Recently tried their roast dinner which also was fantastic. Tried a blood orange draft beer which I would highly recommend if you like blood orange.   This particular location is defitinely unique. Tri level building with a basement in Downtown Phoenix. I believe there was a bar on each floor. We sat up top where there was a billiards table and tons of windows.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roast dinner and blood orange draft beer- cornish patsy

lLdCnU2yKWgAywwRyPyHFA.text: Here I am downtown with my son at the Phoenix Hospital. He broke his jaw. He can't eat and we have to wait for surgery. All he wants are mashed potatoes and the Cornish Pasty came through solid. Just to see my son's face when he took that bite. His first good thing today. I am currently writing this at midnight, and I feel that's why it's important. Dinner service was way over and I know they're open late but it's drinkers. These mashed potatoes were just as good as you'd expect them at 6 at night. It says A LOT out of a kitchen that cares about its last dish as much as it's first dish of service; even if it's just mashed potatoes. Bar staff was great and gave me the laugh I needed, even if it was brief. Always loved the Scottsdale location, but we will definitely be back here, except when my son can actually eat a pasty!

xk8pWPRoZw0ynPXj5LdF_w.text: That mushroom soup is dream-worthy. If I could date soup, it'd be that soup. The bread makes it even better. Weird part is, I don't even like mushrooms . And yet, here I am- ordering some on DoorDash as we speak...

DzphDvF29BhSMenbrLZT_g.text: What a neat place. We were bar hopping, so we stopped in for a beer. Great many on tap as well as in bottles. There are 3 parts to this place, the bar downstairs, where you can watch them make Pasties, the upstairs bar, where there is also darts and pool and the basement which doubles as a speak easy.  We sat watching them make the Pasties (a folded pastry case with a savoury filling, typically of seasoned meat and vegetables) and I vowed to come back later during the week. Get the chance right before leaving for the airport and ordered the Pasty we watched them make. Wow, so delish! I ordered the meatball with buffalo mozzarella and basil. Yummy. Their potato, leek and stilton soup is also delish.  Great place for food and drinks!

ar_dRB3QxGPqeMviC1wSqQ.text: Really cool joint with comfortable vibes and music. Great selection of beers.   I never had this kind of food before but I must say I am a fan. It is a bit saltier then I was used to but I'm telling you it was so freaking good. I got the Tiki Masala and it was not bad! Tasted like a tiki Masala in sandwich bun form. A bit strange eating it with your hands rather then scooping it off a plate. I tried some of my friends Royal with Cheese which is their burger version and this might be a good one for someone who doesn't want to get all wild with their tastebuds.   They also got darts and a pool table up top. Come here for great a night of company, conversations, beer, and food!

Zc3GC_ePKJ2toVHu9xQQcA.text: Food is fun, anything you want wrapped in a thin flaky crust.  Pizza, fish, steak, veggies.. You name it they put it in a pocket of crust!   Beware the place is LOUD and food takes a min on the weekends, but this is a great place for you and your friends to grab a beer on Friday night and laugh the work week away.

qdanwQ7I8MRKihu0gMoD8g.text: One of my all time favorites, has the right mix of laid back ambiance, excellent beers and tasty food!

akGsBw1MWxV9gT_ZLRYNAw.text: Excellent food , Friendly staff, great atmosphere, And import beers from places I've never heard of before.... Had a awesome evening there the hardest part was leaving. Love the new place very well put together !!!!!   5 stars all day long in my book. try the meat and cheese for the safe people and carne Avado if ya like a little spice in your life. desserts are yummy too. We will be back soon thanks again....My wife recommends the pasta salad !!!!!!!

fywzwrQaQaYGXFsDpDLtEw.text: i visited here for the first time on a sunday night before a concert. service was a tad slow, but the waiter was very nice & the food was great! i ordered the cuban & my friend ordered the royale with cheese... mine was WAY better! we also ordered the cheesy fries (chips) w/jalapeno & the jalapeno was insanely spicy! couldn't even eat it! this place is yummy & there are a ton of pasty options! i'd def come here again!

-eOXAZW38tUsLCf9d4iyGA.text: Atmosphere was pretty cool, open to the street. Food was good. I think they are having a hard time keeping up or something because only about 1/3 of the menu choices were available?  It was my birthday and I went as a treat on my 85 yr old next door neighbor. He rarely goes out but I'd mentioned I wanted to check the place out. I had heard it was good. My biggest complaint: with three levels of seating, someone forgot to include handicapped accessible?! My neighbor could neither go up or down stairs and there was hardly any seating on main level. Worst of all, none of the staff seemed to get it. We won't be the first or the last, eventually they will catch on.

g6xgwK_RlPTfHntUOQQP_g.text: Visited the Cornish pasty on a Monday night and seen how welcoming it was. However we decided to go to the basement bar and were met by Hannah Montana. She was the best and curated our drinks to our own taste. Hannah was very attentive and friendly and went out of her way to deliver us what we needed. We will definitely be back!!

dtbaw_owCpNASZV0Nq333g.text: We took our friends to the new Old Town Scottsdale location and sat on the patio on a beautiful Friday evening. It's much more charming then the Tempe and other East Valley locations we've been to. The food is always delicious--I love the red wine gravy that comes with some of the pasties. The service was really neglectful that night and we were charged twice for one glass of wine that we asked two other servers to bring or find our server. We got it straightened out. They are very nice; just not 'on it' that night.

EXvY0AfIaC230Wc_kWe4hw.text: This is the second location Ive been to and the food, atmosphere, etc. was top notch. Oh and the drinks were good too. Me n my friends had the rudest server though... so I feel compelled to complain. Im a bartender myself and have been working in the service for awhile so I can be a harsh critic but this was just soooo bad.  She clearly didnt want to be there, which I get, dont let your customers see that though. She did the thing where she would quickly stop by to mumble " can I get you something?" before any of us could respond shes already walking away.. Slow down girl, damn. We put in chips with our first round of drinks. They took awhile so after not seeing her for 10 min ,and they didnt show I asked her about them. She said they would come with food, okay no problem. Our food gets there with no chips, cool. I ask the gentlemen who dropped our food about them, he checks, our server never put the order in ?! Why didnt she check on em when I asked her the first time? I think I left her 3 bucks on a 70 dollar tab. Im a good tipper too but I actually have to get table service. I feel just taking the order and dropping the drinks doesnt warrant anything close 20%. Guess she didnt want the money. shitty attitude . HOwever ! some dude in a beanie had a clue , he comped the chips we didnt even want anymore and apologized on behalf of the server. Thanks dude ! Whoever you are !

4TQmLzADh6jFCxDtLg67vA.text: Food and service were awesome! Great beer selection! Cool vibe, love the basement! Met the owner, he is a great guy who cares deeply for the quality of his food. Keep it up guys! Glad you are back to the full menu!

m0vYHuma2Q6D9X-Pgep61A.text: Fries were burnt to shit. Jalapenos were so burnt they were black. Service was terrible. Over priced for nasty food.

FkHr9ibLTANihicb-p8lXg.text: Absolutely wonderful! Delicious food, great drinks, terrific nightlife atmosphere! I would definitely recommend the ploughman's platter appetizer if you're out with some friends for drinks. We will certainly be visiting again soon!

_D5ff6nfX-erHaIQfpFzxg.text: The ridiculously long wait was totally worth it! My family and I visited the downtown location last night and you guys were on point! The building is absolutely beautiful, the ambience is perfect. Our waitress was attentive (but not suffocating) and very sweet. The food was just as amazing as always.   Thank you for making my son's birthday celebration memorable. We can't wait to visit again. Keep up the great work!

rYlLT1uykObq9MS2pSNWbg.text: I'm ecstatic they have added another restaurant downtown and glad it is Cornish Pasty.  The food at Cornish Pasty is consistently good and reasonably priced.  The problem I have with the Monroe location is that it just seems a little dingy and dark to me--more like a bar than a restaurant.  Also, we've been at least 4 or 5 times and the service ranges from bad to mediocre.  The last visit we ordered a salad and a pasty and they brought both at the same time.  Our waiter said if we wanted our salad first, we should have stated that.  Really?  I'll continue to eat at Cornish Pasty because their food is good, and I'll probably continue to save money on the tip . . .

24rbzk50j6rJ6H1i2FcOyA.text: We love this place! Three floors to choose from, lots of comfortable nooks to sit in. Couches are awesome and the music is even better! The best pasties are the Reuben and the Lamb Vindaloo. Ask the servers for sauce suggestions. They know them well and the combinations they suggest are always delicious. This has quickly become one of our favorite spots for dinner.

-rwoHpefQAgn2LjhATWKgw.text: This place is AWESOME! Amazing good food and kick ass beer/wine selection. Really great staff took care of us. Are new favorite spot in town.

44cqPHiieZQ-CINq0YdEfw.text: OK.  Never even heard of these things before, but man I wish I had.  ate the Guiness pot pie one and, wow, it was perfect.  Had it with 2 guiness beers.  Yep, it was just right in all the right ways.

wuNX29h-DoY2VvoW2dwZWA.text: I've long loved the Tempe location of Cornish Pasty. There, the service is awesome and the food is even better. That said, in four tries, I've never had a positive experience at the downtown Phoenix location. The first time, my order was incorrect. The second time, it took 20 minutes to be served drinks, and another 45 minutes to be served food. The third time, my order was incorrect again. Today, on my fourth visit for an early lunch, we ordered immediately -- a veggie tikka masala pasty and my usual, the Caesar salad with salmon. My boyfriend also ordered a draught IPA, and we were served at the bar. Our food took more than 50 minutes to arrive, without apology or explanation. It was delicious, as usual, but the kitchen at this location is clearly having a hard time making things work. What's more, for a little day drinking, the beer prices are dumb. $6.40 for a local IPA is pushing it, especially when this location doesn't offer the cheap beer options (Mickey's) that we all know and love from the Tempe location. Really hoping that this place can pull it together.

AM8MLFegruL42YmEfogDBQ.text: Great food! Atmosphere was still lively and comfortable at 1am. They have several floors and seating areas for different ambiance. Food and service was on point!!

JBufQI9_iMIbs85Vk1RRjg.text: I got the Cuban pasty, almost the best thing to graze my lips..... get it...ommmmgggg

Y_IeMh7m4RiuTr2nkUoaHw.text: Had my rehearsal dinner here and the food was amazing! The guys were very helpful and reserved some tables on the second floor since we had a large party. It was all set up when we got there and the staff was quick in getting order turned around for the group!

RJXbTPpdIcdpmd09gQg9lw.text: Great food-I really enjoyed the Guinness stew pasty.  Unfortunately, it is a bit pricey ($24 for a pasty, beer and broccoli) and service was slow (1.5 hours for lunch) even though the place was not very crowded.

ECIKTKVoONRNIUfQUUXY1Q.text: Excellent pastys and salads! Great atmosphere,  fast service. Cute location near historic hotel.

IJuCah8ZI-1ikSLW9QxSrA.text: Good food. Had the Leek/potato soup with Stilton (I was curious about the combination, and it was perfect!).  I also had the Oggie pasty with gravy. Many vegetarian options. Friendly server. Lots of different places to sit, I found a quiet place upstairs. Will definitely come again when in Phoenix.

gl1GI2LQaiELqwuO-1MbqA.text: My go to unique Phoenix Restaurant that I take people to when they are in town. Any soup, half a Carne Adovada, and the treacle desert is the best meal I can think of

_QaTbAu5uH_u2-tw3m-T5Q.text: They are still in the process of their soft opening so they have a limited menu. Luckily "The Pilgrim" was there which is my go-to and it was delicious! Food took a bit longer than I'm use to but again they are about a week open. I'll be back soon to see how they run with the full menu and if they can pick up the pace. The atmosphere is perfect, very nice flow through out and reminds me of the Mill Ave location the most. Bright and open on the main floor, dark with a large bar up top. I didn't get a chance to look around down stairs but was told their is additional seating. It was a great experience overall!

XpNjJ6EyM4vurz_tmeB1Gg.text: Got into Phoenix for business very late and my nearby hotel had a bar/restaurant, but the kitchen had already closed so the bar staff told me that I should go to Cornish. I walked over and loved the idea of the walk up bar/patio set up, but ended up going downstairs which had a bit of an underground club feel (all the way down to the eclectic choices in music). I ordered a roast beef sarnie with a horseradish sour cream and a drink. The drink came out right away and the food too a bit of time, but it was well worth it. It was VERY fresh out of the oven and I burned my fingers several times but I kept eating because it was so good. Two days later (today), I brought my coworker back here for lunch and had soup and an appetizer. They were also good. I may go back tomorrow before I leave!

M-1CkTfEq2Sq7lpQi6dNXA.text: Definitely can recommend. We walked from a nearby hotel at lunch in 109 heat and were very glad that this fine restaurant was so close. I enjoyed an Old Fashioned ($9) as we read the menu and then ordered a delicious Cubano pasty ($12) and enjoyed the beer that our server, Lucy, recommended to go with it. My wife liked a Meet & Cheese pasty ($10.50) and an Au Bon chardonnay ($12). Very nice atmosphere.

X5v2xqmk94JVk4i--RDTKQ.text: Had a function downtown today, planned on eating at Cornish Pasty....until we saw the #redfored sign.   We will not be supporting a political organization that uses children as pawns nor will we support the sheep that blindly follow them.

qUY4dkMVo2OR3wlnNWSItg.text: I used to like this place. I am a guest at the Hilton right next to this place. I sat down , the waiter intentionally got the order from people who came 5-10 minutes after me. Then he gets my order I wait for the food 30-40 minutes. In the mean time the other party had a soup and a pasty already and enjoying their conversation. I just flew into Phoenix and had skipped lunch and dinner. I am hungry but I was ignored the whole time. I felt weird sitting their looking like a fly on a wall. I came back and ordering at 12.30 am Uber eats and waiting for my dinner at the hotel. What a day!

S4SpTGXtkdJPUblFabIo2g.text: The food was great! I wanted to eat outside but it allowed pets outside in its seating and bar area. The waiter was friendly but never came back to see if we needed refills.

iLOyGpt02PSbx5eVOOKeoQ.text: This place is so unique and quaint! My husband and I stopped before an event and had a drink and shared a plate in the basement bar. Ariel was our bartender and was great but the most amazing part . . . I left my phone sitting on the bar and left for the show (I know, I'm a moron). We called 20 minutes later and Ariel had turned it in and the street level bartender offered to personally hold it himself until we returned to pick it up after the show. True to his word, he had it in his pocket when we got there 3 hours later.  We will definitely be back for the drinks, food and especially the service!!

oN0zHrBdyX0VnGzpPwCisA.text: This was so good. I guess it's a new location and the atmosphere was great. The kids loved the Scottish eggs and out pasties were all good. Had salmon, chicken, and bangers and mash. Service was very attentive.

3jmA6Q71u3koG0QhPtLARg.text: Amazing place with great food.  The orders are huge and I suggest sharing a meal.  The ingredients are fresh and it's all top notch from start to end.  Eat here

StrYf17ShRL74uQs2p4GWw.text: The food is always great but tonight the service was just horrible.  Erik our "server" came by maybe once. Our salad came out with the food and our soup after all that.  My husband had to go to the bar for our drinks since he never came back for our drink order. Going back for food but hopefully another server.

Waff_BSJ_e8Yl7Tc2Lrv5g.text: YUMMY! very cute place. Has 3 floors based off what kind of atmosphere you want, which i thought was pretty cool! very pub-ish feeling, but with a romantic touch. The food was very yummy, different concept which I loved! We had the Chicken Tikka pasty & the Peppered steak pasty along with a couple of glasses of wine & of course had dessert - chocolate bread & butter pudding with ice cream. I highly recommend it if you are in downtown phoenix!

pEAAJyYdsy3MRX-7YxrZJw.text: This is my guilty pleasure downtown late night spot. Fantastic pastys. My favorite is the Bangers and Mash. Good cocktails, quick service, free pool tables and darts. Three stories with cool dim atmosphere.   My boyfriend loves the IPAs and the Lamb and Mint pasty, and I always get the Bangers and Mash with a glass of wine.

rXRex7AuOez0QOtcFGBNCw.text: What a great place to eat at! The menu is very unique and the Pasties were very good! The mushroom soap with walnuts was delicious!!

mTtshnMI4ffqmgWQudH3kA.text: Found this place on our way to another pub and decided to stop in after seeing that there were 3 levels to choose from. I didn't even have time to check the Yelp reviews but the menu spoke for itself. Fabulous cocktails and an extensive menu. I had the "Italian Cornish pastry" and all I can say was "wow"! Very fresh and tasty. The drinks are strong and crafted beautifully. If you are looking for something better than typical Pub Fare then this is your place, it's comfort food in a place where you have three entirely different settings; al fresco, bar and romantic! All in one place. Very hard to find a concept like this and it be enjoyable. Service was great and if I'm ever in the Phoenix area again I am definitely coming back.

CGBKEuZqzq473X--6PIOmA.text: We go here a lot. We are always down town when we do go out. We always drink too much and need food to soak up the booze. I want something vegan and my husband wants something that's gonna fill him up. The only thing I hate is when they run out of vegan pasties. Then we have to go across the street for a beyond burger. WbEG97-Mec8ofwg5jKFQUg.text: Cornish is a great place to go if you are a meat and potatoes kinda person! This is like a hot pocket, but better! They have fresh ingredients, and they are made right on the spot for you. The downtown Phoenix location feels like walking into an old cathedral, with bench seats and everything! The staff was so nice to us as well. They even prepared meals and brought treats for the puppies that we had brought with us and were sitting out on the patio with.
