PHDPSiUjbX8QshzYt946vA.text: I wanted something tasty and filling. The meatball pasty hit the spot. Good meatballs, cheese and sauce. The dough was on point. I took my food to go so I didn't get to try out the restaurant's atmosphere. Would come back again.

Qs-l4TdUIIyWVIbOXDo9kQ.text: Cornish Pasty in general is awesome but I think this one has the coolest vibe and is the best location. We sat downstairs and it's got a very "speakeasy-ish" feel to it and the drink selection is the best here (different cocktails then I've encountered at other Cornish's).

BzFRf2CfKRiZoQAM9NIjaQ.text: We spent a weekend in Phoenix for the Royal Rumble and this ended up being our favorite spot to go after the shows. It was walking distance from our hotel and had a killer vibe. We didn't get to see much of upstairs but downstairs had a cool speakeasy sort of vibe. It was dimly lit with red lighting. The service was very friendly and they made some great drinks for us. The food was amazing. I had one of the best Cuban sandwiches of my life and my friend had some sort of potato wedge starter that he loved. Thank you for your hospitality.

Krjjne7YJGy27eKtLKeeaQ.text: I recently discovered this place and I have been here a half dozen times since.  Very good pasties!  A pasty is basically a Cornish pie, similar to a calzone.  They have all kinds of flavors, but my favorite is the Cajun Chicken.  They also have some great brew on tap, and a Long Island that will knock you on your butt! Awesome place!

2SN6-QvMkMQAVaTXfw5YeA.text: I used to work in downtown Phoenix and this place was slated to open for a long time. I'm glad it's here and I got to visit for dinner this weekend.   It's an interesting setup; they've got some outdoor seating and you walk in to what seems like a small space. However, they have a basement as well as a second floor, both set up lounge style. They really took a creative spin and I thought it was great. The hostess greeted us and gave us the rundown: we seat ourselves and the server comes by with menus. We chose to sit downstairs and I loved all the booths and private spaces. It was dark in typical CP style but didn't detract.   My friend and I ordered waters and their oven chips as an appetizer. Delicious! They came with complimentary jalapenos and garlic topping and the potatoes were crispy and flavorful with no hint of greasiness. My first choice of pasty was unavailable unfortunately so I went with one I've tried before, the veggie chicken tikka masala. My friend got the veggie Mexican. My order came out wrong and I received the veggie cottage pie instead, and I decided to take it instead of waiting longer for my original order. We split our pasties and I liked the Mexican but not the cottage so much. However, our server was apologetic about the order mixup and didn't charge us for the second pasty.   I do love the buttery flaky crust (props if you get my reference haha) and I learned that the crimped edges means those are the vegetarian pasties. Way cool! Despite the snafu, I will come back to CP. This is a neat location to check out in downtown Phoenix, walking distance from other entertainment venues.

Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie cottage pie on the left, veggie Mexican on the right

IPSMIZWN-AsKYoSSftz_vg.text: Phenomenal! What a find - delicious food and an incredible selection of pasties  had the chicken tikka and the Guinness beef stew pasty.

xUwUtw8tIf-km5a_spP_0Q.text: My absolute favorite place to eat and grab a beer!!! Plus they have pool tables! Eddie is the best!

A8_kqgp-CJXB9NutjIXRFA.text: Huge servings, great food, and fantastic ambiance. Food is traditional yet there are some new flavors too. Ploughman's platter I'd huge, tasty and filling. Pasties dough is perfectly bland (so it doesn't interfere with the fillings!), yet crisp and flaky when you bite into it. Downstairs lounge was cozy and retro. Love it and will definitely be back on a future trip.

o3z7vtWYbZdsc9Xt55UeMQ.text: One of our favorites! We like to bring out of town visitors to Cornish Pasty for a delicious and filling meal. They have flavors for every palate and we can easily dine here with our kids, as picky as they are. The decor is also fun and interesting.

eSk7uUKHFbq8e32ZFMGeoQ.text: Unprofessional brunette waitress on Saturday 1/27 couldn't turn her head to answer a question.  She rudely told us to go upstairs without even stopping or turning to look at us.  If you want to be treated with respect, don't come to this place. Also, don't be surprised if a large walking tour comes in and ruins the atmosphere even more.

m7URfedKAQ-GVQVZjqBqAw.text: A dizzying variety of tasty pasties - so hard to choose because each one is delicious.  But the lamb or the chicken pot pie are favorites.  The salads are also outstanding- fresh, varied, and plentiful.  I like topping the garden salad with the Salmon with white balsamic dressing.

uDFfarMaEWLivS79uEEkcg.text: Grew up on Pasty's as a holiday food treat for most of my childhood. Move up to Phoenix and realize there is a really cool place that makes delicious pasty's, serves a gazillion good beers and has a chill vibe? Sign me up! Oggie pasty is old faithful, love the filling and the gravy that accompanies it. Had many others and haven't been disappointed. I would like to try some of the more exotic models butttttt that og pasty is just so. damn. good. I really like the inside decor and furnishings, music can be uh... eclectic, which adds to the cool vibe. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JWBHlu3-eP6JFbcuSOpH-w.text: The wait is *finally* over! Cornish Pasty has soft opened their downtown location. And I couldn't be more smitten.   Allen texted me during an especially gruelling day of work announcing this restaurant was opened and invited me to dinner. How could I resist?! When we arrived, the place was bustling and the main floor was packed. So we made our way upstairs to the huge dining area. We were promptly brought waters and menus, and asked about the best appetizers to order. We opted for the chicken liver pate and an order of Scotch egg. The pate was fantastic! The flavors popped and we agreed this was something we would eat with a spoon if no one was watching. I recommend getting the toasted bread with this. The Scotch egg was perfectly cooked and served with a side of honey mustard. It was good enough without the dipping sauce, but it added another layer to the experience.  Now, for what they're known for: the pasties. I ordered the lamb and mint, plus a side of mashed rutabaga because I've never had mashed rutabaga. (Truth be told,  I actually ordered the rutabaga because it was a code word in an episode of Charmed. Gosh, did I really admit that?!?). I love lamb, and this played perfectly into my love of this meat. While the mashed rutabaga was a tab salty, it still had great flavor and together with the pasty made for a filling meal. So much so that I ended up taking half home. I'm thinking lustfully of heating this up for lunch tomorrow.   Service was pleasant and the atmosphere was wonderful! Allen mentioned it would have been great if they had opened when his dad and step mom were in town, but we'll have a destination for them next year when they are back in town. For being their soft opening, everything appeared to go without a hitch, and I can't wait to get back and eat through the menu. I even think there is something my David will find familiar enough to eat.

Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scotch egg. Delish.
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken liver pate. Amazing!

5caIRAbsrd02-i_Iep8SJQ.text: Went on a Friday night for the first time and my group of 7 got a table within 5 minutes. The food was amazing and I will definitely be getting the shepherd's pie again sometime.

orUme6VKAbAOTEXTDFG-HQ.text: Pasty's was really good. First time to this location. Unique building with the 3 levels to dine in. Will be back for some more pasty options to try.

sDVlVNd5btaKnp--PS59og.text: Fun concept and good food. I had The Pilgrim, and our server Colson took great care to help my husband find a garlic free food because of his food allergy

7WksD3-r1zzkljYf5WHPJQ.text: Located in the heart of downtown, this is a great place for the working person, student, or juror to grab a meal.   This place was pretty packed when my fiance brought us here for lunch. We walked up to the upper level which was dark and had a great pub feel. We took a seat by the windows and waited for a server to come around.   Service: it took a while to get a menu, but once they came, they returned frequently to check up on us and grab the order. Service isn't the fastest here, partially because it's a more casual environment, and partially because the food takes a while to make.   Food: its worth the wait. We ended up getting the Pilgrim after we were told that they were out of the Bangers and Mash. These Cornish pasties are humongous and delicious. We split the one pasty and it was the perfect lunch, but maybe on the lighter side for my fiance. The thing is, they're dense meals, so be prepared to feel heavy if you end up devouring the whole pasty by yourself (which is always so darn tempting). Sharing is recommended.  The Pilgrim was excellent and filled with a savory mix of stuffing, sweet potatoes, and turkey. Covered it gravy and cranberry sauce, it was too good. Hello Fall.   We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The menu. Not all items are available, so make sure you have a contingency plan.
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They split the pasty for us. This is the Pilgrim.

DFrbjoWoEeUnXAG_ujigJQ.text: We walked into this restaurant with absolutely no idea what a "pasty" was, but we were in a new city and decided we should branch out and try something new.  The atmosphere was...gothic, maybe? I'm not sure how to describe it. It was darkly lit (mood lighting), with long, heavy wooden tables, wooden pews for seating, ornate black lanterns, etc. Overall, we enjoyed the atmosphere.  As for food, we ordered The Oggie (traditional pasty), which has steak, potatoes, rutabega, and is served with red wine gravy. We shared one and immediately regretted that we didn't order our own. We finished it so quickly because it was that good.  We are giving this restuarant a 4 star because we didn't try any other foods or drinks, so we can't say overall how great this restaurant is.  BOTTOMLINE: we will return and we recommend! (We actually did return the next day and bought another one to go, but we were approached by a homeless man who asked if we had any food. With a metaphorical tear, we gave away our untouched Oggie to someone who needed it more).

rdw8DKt2U8FIIdyy7ijKcA.text: Stopped in for lunch today and had a similar experience to my last visit. The tone here is much less friendly than the other Cornish Pasty's. The hostess today was downright mean. Ok, she was pretty pregnant, but she didn't even attempt to act a little nice. Everyone in the place was grouchy.   Other than feeling unwanted, my pasty was good.  I will continue to frequent the Tempe and Mesa locations.

Ipu_yGJ-voUdIu3aqoSVlQ.text: Came here with a large group of friends after a wedding we all went to downtown and got seated right away upstairs. Loved the ambiance of the bar, the photos, the pool tables, very cool vibe going on at night. Waitress was friendly and attentive. Nice selection of beers. Make sure you save room for the PB&J pasty....it's amazing!  I think we have tried the pilgrim, the lamb and mint, the cubana and both the vegan and chicken tikka. Everything has been great!

arMZKA_ofBczHVUxyFIHtQ.text: We didn't eat here, so this review is purely based on customer service.  Entered Cornish Pasty Co with a large group on Saturday night and asked if there was an area large enough to accommodate our group.  We were told by the hostess that the main floor and upper floor were "full" and that we should not bother trying to get seated.  At this point, we were considering leaving.     ...On a whimsy, we went downstairs to check the space out, and it was largely empty. From the minute we walked into Cornish Pasty Co we felt the workers were discouraging our business.

Yr_ko6-TxnIgV0Ff_4o__g.text: Love the cool atmosphere and the pasties are soooooo delicious!! Lots of different types of seating areas, including a charming area with church pews and pool tables upstairs. Will go many more times now that we discovered this one.

7ftaQDs1pQi9SIKMmDjD0Q.text: Holy bland balls....I felt like I was eating garbage stuffed into a sad tasteless pocket of emptiness. Yikes, pictures look good but damnnn are they inaccurate. Nice servers, good beer, solid vibe but SHIT this food makes me sad. Just sad. Try some salt, fuck.

EAErO1OTa2qCl3ggE8MmAw.text: Love this place. 2nd time here. Went to a concert down town and had to come back. Great Pasties. Good beer selection. Fast & friendly service, so much so that we came back after the concert for drinks. Close to The Comerica & the Van Buren. Highly recommend.

ko77iykZ30_DNuOdvRAOEw.text: Somehow there's maybe 1-2 British/Euro pubs in Tucson, but Phoenix has the whole market covered, including this establishment. I've always enjoyed meats and savory ingredients stuffed inside pastry dough, and I'm glad I tried my first ever pasty here.  The cool part about this place is the open kitchen concept. Sitting at the bar, enjoying a pint with your pasty and chatting it up with the bartender, you also get to see the pasties being made from start to finish.   The prep and wait time are both worth it (about 25-30 min wait). These things are a meal in themselves and the quality of the ingredients is very fresh. I went with a classic shepherd's pie. Lots of ground lamb, potatoes, peas, carrots and cheese. And the pastry was cooked perfectly. Washed down with a proper pint, you get a satisfying meal.  The only downsides were of no fault to the restaurant itself. A lot of the patrons seemed to be bar hopping as a few drunk girls didn't know what pasties were (pronounced rhyming with "hasty" thinking it's the decorative thing you put over your nipples) and asked for really specific mixed drinks, one guy broke a glass by the entrance, and one 40-something Guy Fieri type didn't know "what are those pastries." The music was loud and likely a playlist the cooks put together as I wouldn't think of Metallica and Black Sabbath pairing with pasties, but I give it a pass because they are hard at work and just want hype music.  So, do check this place out for a proper pasty, but don't feel obligated to eat in house. They also ship their products, which is a plus until they open a location in Tucson.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shepherd&#39;s pie pasty with red wine gravy

6yhS0sdmb0pX-WVVAVkJ4w.text: The Cornish pasty's aren't that great. If you are a pub person, then maybe you would like this place.  I came here with a family of 5 and I don't think we would come back.  The home made bread was good though and the service as well.

EQShgegVhLk4w-aef8tOcg.text: Been at this location twice. I love Cornish. I just always have lucky they are out of something  when I go. This night, they didn't have the 2 beers I wanted to try....

949dF7DdpUD_lrjAH015xQ.text: Scottish comfort food. Great atmosphere and service. Make sure to try the Mushy Peas. It is YUMMY. The decor is another plus. I prefer the second floor. We came here on Sunday night at 11pm and there was a good number of people here. Munchies friendly for sure.

eH-XfCmj0EX5QXZoKssfnw.text: Tastes like a big empanada, nothing special, on the pricey side for what you get.  My Arnold Palmer was $3.50 which was ridiculous!!

GjADn71TFGMJnIFnCff6Uw.text: I like this place and love some of the food. The bar is great and the dining is cozy. That said, the quality, especially of the Minted Lamb Pasty has gone down in the past few months.   Still a great place to drop in for a late night meal.

RuEE2ogm5luJidfj_Uza-Q.text: I had never tried a pasty until recently and I can say I am slightly obsessed! The atmosphere is really fun here and they have a space to sit at the bar, as well. They had a great selection of beers and although the one I wanted had just run out on tap, the server gave a great recommendation and I loved her choice. The menu is a Vegans dream! They are extremely accommodating to dietary preferences and they use one of my favorite meat substitutes, Quorn. I was very happy with my selection and will be back very soon!

i3R2Kunro3rnJANh2uPaLQ.text: Where has then been all my life!? The Cornish Pasty Co has something for everyone (even vegetarians and vegans!) The menu consists of many different types of pasties. What is a pasty you say (pronounced Pah-stee, not Pay-stee)?! A pasty is a delightful breaded pocket of deliciousness stuffed to the brim with a whole slew of different fillings--think a baked empanada. The more traditional pasties are chunks of chicken or beef with gravy and carrots, onions etc (think a hearty stew). Cornish Pasty Co has gone where no pasty has gone before and has a huge selection ranging from Mediterranean, Mexican, traditional, vegetarian, and sweet. I live in Tucson, but any time that I make it up to Phoenix this is often my first stop. They make these ultra fresh, so the wait time can be a deterrent for some; luckily you can enjoy a pint or cocktail in a quaint and comfortable setting while you wait. They also sell half baked pasties to take home and finish in your own oven, we end up doing this far to often!   Overall, I think the Cornish Pasty Co has something for every taste and desire. Give them a try and learn some of the cool history behind this delicious pocket of goodness.

4ph6R7pYzsF_0-XbrY4qfg.text: Such a great place! The food is great, the environment is great. Cornish is always my first or last stop before a night out.

imzaEXM89kLWkT2uPzCCgg.text: Delicious!! Stumbled into this and such a welcomed surprise! Had the Shepherd pie pasty. Perfect!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

c033YlsTX2DMZbrdzpgNpg.text: I came to order food to go with a co-worker yesterday (3/3/2017). We sat at bar to wait and they offered us waters right away while we waited. I ordered the shepherd pie pasty and is was delicious!! It went great with the red wine sauce that comes with it! I also ordered the Carmel apple pie pasty which was very good as well, my only complaint is the whipped cream was bland. Like no vanilla flavor, no sugar. It was like eating whipped half and half or fluff with no purpose since so tasteless. My other co workers complained about it too. Portions are big, even with one pasty, you'll have leftovers.   The place just opened across the street from my job. You enter from the street into a bar area to the left and a few tables to right (plus the tables on patio out front). In the middle is stairs going down to a basement level. I didn't go down there, so not sure if it's for workers or open to public. Then there are stairs on both sides of the restaurant going up to another floor with more tables to sit and eat. I really liked the feel and look of the place. It was packed with lots of people. Staff was very nice and helpful. I will be back!

HZbNX8tWz0QVbPVVTivPqA.text: Found this place by walking around Phoenix downtown... Great service, awesome selection of brew and fantastic food! Will definitely come back next time I am in AZ.

vJgzwo2G02-kOvQ0YBCJfg.text: My favorite restaurant in town! My family is from the mid-east (MI) and pasty's is a great treat. The Oggie is my favorite.

GcNlsttvpxnh2O9VZa_DhA.text: Haley, the bartender, was PHENOMENAL. I highly recommend everyone to visit with her and enjoy some drinks together. I've never had a better conversation with a bartender before and I can't wait to see her again!

czWlevrm15yW8BiQKG_wLg.text: Oh how I wanted to love this place. My mom used to make us beef pasty's as a kid and I really wanted to love it. I was SUPER disappointed. I got the roast beef pasty and it took forever to arrive. Which was ok, I figured it takes a while to cook one, however, when it did arrive it was just warm. I expected it to be piping hot, as a fresh baked pasty should be.  I assume it was ready but sat waiting to be brought out and cooked off.  I would have sent it back but didn't have time. I didn't care for the red wine gravy, would have preferred a basic brown gravy. I will try it again and probably just get a more basic pasty. So bummed.

R_C3dkr-WWJXiJ4yIdiD4g.text: The manager contacted me and changed the open door policy. and thanked me for bringing it to their attention. This is how a business succeeds, not by necessarily avoiding mistakes, but how they address them. I ate there today and had one of the 4 vegan options. The mushroom stew pasty was fantastic. I'm also a big fan of the vindaloo. They building is has 3 levels, and it open and airier than the Tempe site. Thanks for love.

D2-t7yDhQxGhaBPb2UlSNg.text: Pros:  Great food, large food and beer menu and great layout with three floors. Friendly staff.     Cons:  poor execution and preparation . When we came, thy ran out of several entrees as well as basic items like chips (French fries) and most appetizers.    I have been to the other Pasty locations in Tempe and Scottsdale and they are great.  This location needs work.

2YdhvNvoJAYnCKyXqCwmQA.text: Love this place. Never had a bad pasty. They are so hearty and delicious with a great beer and cider selection. Atmosphere is fun and easy going, definitely a place you want to hang out for a while.

P2a-6GIEJPIOT_jELG7qrQ.text: Excellent pot pie & witty, amazing service. Very quaint atmosphere but enjoyable for the worker bees that are traveling.

LgCT15jgiG1hHcY-uE5kUw.text: Humble atmosphere. Great to watch them make the pasties right in front of you. Good serving. Lots of choices.

FiCvhyap10t8UkCx348V7w.text: I have always liked this place and still do...great food, drinks and service. The downtown locations is quite nice. Hey, chef, I know it's the rosemary chicken pasty but you don't need 10 sprigs of rosemary in there next time ok, I don't want to eat a christmas tree....  I'll still be back though!

rmnvx71U8xJO5fv5-Y0jtA.text: When we decided to go to Cornish Pasty, I wasn't sure it would be a good choice.  My friends made the selection. When we walked in, the place was packed and, with open seating, we had a difficult time finding a table.  However, once I began eating I totally changed my mind. The roast pasty was delicious. Full of roast beef, vegetables, and gravy in a great tasting pastry. And quite a sizable portion that my wife and I split.  I also had a cup of potato leek soup. It too was very flavorful. The soup was only lukewarm but it tasted so good I ate it anyway. I should have mentioned it to our server but it was St. Patrick's Day and they were so busy. Considering the day and how busy they were the service was excellent. I can't wait to go back!

CpjPqEN79v4TW7B2jzh8bQ.text: The cheeseburger royal pasty is amazeballs! Plus today's musical selection was Motorhead and you can't go wrong with meat and metal music!

jUIJ1Odn1wK3o6tKTTy1og.text: This has quickly become one of my favorite places to eat downtown! Our waitress was friendly and attentive. The food is really good, my favorite is the guiness stew pasty and their potato leak soup! Also their bread and butter is delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Potato leak soup
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken pot pie.

wJTieg1bl-J1nyY08OxAWQ.text: Great service, great food and great location. Whether you're looking for a simple bite to eat or a drink on a date night, this place has a great atmosphere for any occasion.

iAQdty1qfVdDQJ08J1Fv5g.text: I like that you can spend couple of hours here eating drinking and playing on pool tables. I like their soups and vegan options.   The tikka wings are the best.

slQYPz7YvoTvGMegjD-fvg.text: If you want authentic pasties outside of Cornwall this is the place to go. Expect a short wait while you enjoy a drink as they cook to order but you will not be disappointed. Also dog friendly on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mAHemwlZU6fu6c2UC6giVw.text: this place has the worst service.   They are not welcoming or polite  and they don't seem like they want or need your business.   (This is for the 7th and Monroe downtown location)   I will never suggest anyone go there.   I spent a large amount of money there and they still had a  crappy attitude.  Aaron.. thank you for your response. I was there on March 1st.  I dont want to describe the girl that "helped" me here on this forum . I would rather send you a personal email

inWp-7K5LHERH48mKXHVww.text: Gotta say I was skeptical the 1st 15 mins I was here because everything that could go wrong was. The wonderful Erick helped me decide on what to eat and the manager Dean created an amazing Cajun Chicken pasty that was cooked to perfection. The pasty itself was a little bland, but I'm happy it wasn't overly salted. The Chipotle sauce that comes with the pasty was perfect. I can't wait to come back and try more food.

t56Uaf9bI9FQP2T6rC9fAA.text: Surprisingly delicious. Came here with three pals on a Saturday evening before a Sun Devils football game. Loved the food (I had the "traditional Oggie") and enjoyed a pint of cider on tap. Looking forward to bringing others here. Good stuff!

OG0fYLaGARrEtxN6W2JNHw.text: This spot would get a 5 if their dessert was tasty. Ordered two different desserts and neither were tasty. Very appealing to the eye but not to the tongue. However, they were nice enough to not charge me for one dessert. BUT, they have an IPA there called the dragoon, it is a must try if you like IPA's!!!  I love this spot!

Uoat7Gh07kBCDiU-BOUF1g.text: Not the best soft opening I've been to. Everyone was frazzled. We ordered two scotch eggs but they only had one left :( and wasn't particularly good. It took about 15 min and three different people to confirm there was a vegan pasty available though the menu said there would always be two options and none of the dessert ones we wanted were available. Everyone in our party thought the food was overly salty, including the mushy peas. The service wasn't great, but forgivable since he was brand new and was trying so very hard to please us with a great attitude while being completely lost. I hope they can improve over time. I would try it again maybe after giving them a few more months.

OhV66Hw1qQ8hwUo-PJ-fbA.text: Ambiance is amazing! Food is fantastic. What an awesome venue and great addition to downtown Phoenix. Check this place out!

BHI1v23UOzadFsXW6DwX7A.text: If I can give this place zero stars I would they don't even deserve one! We went here for the first time sat down to order then my husband became ill. We just ordered food from the waitress and had to leave. The waitress blocked our way saying we cannot leave and had to pay for food they didn't even have a chance to make. Seriously ridiculous unprofessional and absolutely rude!! The Waitress and another guy followed my family and I video recording us and saying they were going to call the police as if we dined and ditched or did some sort of a crime that we did not! How embarrassing and sickly of them to do this to us! We were followed for blocks back to our vehicle in a parking garage and the guy proceeded to yell that he was calling the police and that we needed to pay. I asked him why would we pay when we barely ordered from the menu and my husband became sick?? He proceeded to say I don't care and you need to pay. I have never and will never eat at this restaurant!

Sm6jROMbVNtqgSF0sKskyw.text: Amazing pastys!!!!! Soooo many options and extensive vegetarian menu too. Great service. We had a large group of 10 that came here after a concert and got there at 11:30pm there kitchen was still fully open and running. Great service.

H05mU3rp4Rft5FgHSVZRJw.text: Fun/hipster vibe with 3 levels - lower lounge, first level bar tops, second floor billiards and bar top tables. Great group of friendly staff. Wide variety (that's an understatement) of pasties. Delicious Greek salad with excellent green garlicky dressing. The Guiness pasty has much cheesy goodness and some hearty flavor and good presence of rosemary. You can see the staff making fresh pasties front-of-house as you sip a brew on the first floor. Their desserts are all house made and the dark chocolate brandy bread and butter bread pudding is excellent (with the creme anglaise of course!). The banofee pie is great as well. Looking forward to trying the Tikka Masala salad or pasty.

a5Jslov_Ps2tPEo5NaTWgw.text: I don't normally leave reviews on Yelp, but In this case I had to make an exception. The name "Cornish Pasty Co" is a little disingenuous. The crust is way off, too buttery, not enough fat, not enough salt, etc. And the seam is definitely in the wrong place. "Marie Calendar's Pasty Company" would be a better name.     That said, the food is priced pretty low for what you get, and they are made from scratch.  It's actually a nice place for lunch if you're not expecting authentic pastys.

w6hB-H2MFvU5-ae1SY34iQ.text: This is the best place to visit for food or fun in downtown, the "pasties" are amazing, aptly describes as giant hot pockets, but SO MUCH better! Try the royal with cheese l, or the pilgrim, can't go wrong, friendly staff (especially Jessa) service with a smile, and a great selection on tap, you will not regret stopping here for lunch, I promise!

N1kGtPE8QNeosS745lk_EA.text: I visited for a late dinner and drink. My cocktail was made to perfection and the Reuben pasty was delicious! They have Great selection of craft draft beer.

TRDcdhq1IFwLc_FFcM_9qw.text: Good place to eat! First time to have a pasty and it was delicious! Make sure you try the mushroom and walnut soap!! Very good! The bread that came with the soap was just as good! Nice place to hang out with friends and family.

Yhcim3PPtp6ZZTSNWIzkxg.text: Just finished dinner were we ordered three pastries. The pastry was great but the filling on all three was very salty.  We had a much better experience at the tempe location.

yqFD6EqCWZ9jq-fMrXKCGg.text: The Cornish Pasty is one of my favorite hang out spots downtown. I haven't had a pasty yet but the atmosphere is exactly what I want, it almost feels like I'm in a medieval pub. 3 levels of seating, pool tables, great drinks, and great music.

JPXvvBZAqKEjrIHJMESt3Q.text: This place has slow service for a restaurant bar at midnight when there is only two customers in the bar. Do you want a beverage too bad they won't ask till you've been there for 15 minutes. But don't worry they will tell you about how bad every place around them is and why while the exhibit the same behavior.

bERaXXksozDyJTXmP22nsw.text: Their Royale w/ Cheese IS a tasty pasty!  My colleagues were split on the authenticity of the pasties themselves. Service was slow, iced tea was so-so. Music was louder than expected for lunch time. Good prices. Will probably go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cornish Pasty - Phoenix, AZ, United States

G-Ek5cbTd3DMwzIux9nYTg.text: I loved the new location. Went during a nice day so we sat outside. Finally a place where I can eat vegan and my boyfriend can eat meat. I only wish you could order more styles vegan. I really want to try so many ones!! Oh my at that vegan coleslaw was like crack I need that recipe. Oh and the womens bathroom I dunno why but I was in love with the floors and wallpaper.

o_Bs6MS_KYmiS5PVuagqKA.text: New to downtown great vibe upstairs and a basement. The mood is casual and free pool upstairs. Friendly staff and great atmosphere all together. Need to visit this place. It will stay on my list to frequent.

09cfyz_XZj-14BTIGCt2cg.text: this place is dope... hands down money well spent... on a date or just with friends... its the place to be for a good time...

DCUtmfuQKDzTvC8SiDJk0Q.text: My friends and I came for lunch on opening day, and everything was perfect! Great service, very cool vintage-goth decor, and food amazing as always! Excited to come here again. Thanks for exceeding my expectations, Pasty people!
